description:
Pros: They have a great lunch menu! They have a nice variation of lunch combos. They bentos are great because you can get a little bit of everything. I can always get a table too during lunch time.

Cons: Like all the other reviews, the waitress is superrrrrr slow because there's only one. There's usually just one person preparing the food and another attending tables. Aside from that, I've never really had any issues here.

Ordered: Usually the salmon teriyaki and sashimi bento combo

Would I recommend: Yes! It's a nice quiet neighborhood lunch place if you're in the area. Even at that lunch time it doesn't get too packed so you can always get a seat. Pretty basic Japanese grubs.
author: Terry N.

description:
The service was really nice, but as for the food I was NOT impressed. By the way they do not serve hot sake or beer here. 

I ordered a sushi roll with the salmon teriyaki and both were really grim. The sushi roll seemed like it had imitation crab in it, & it looked rather odd. The salmon teriyaki was luke warm/cold to the touch & the portion was tiny and it oddly had bones in it. They both seemed like they had been sitting around somewhere waiting; not made to order. Also I was served a tiny portion of rice & the waiter said they were low on rice which left me clueless.

I should've complained but I was very tired/hungry & the waiter was so lovely that I hadn't thought the food would've been so terrible. He was friendly & served an extra bowl of miso soup in the beginning which had my hopes up, but once my food arrived I was put off; it was frightfully terrible.

The food again was really grim & I won't be returning but I did give 2 stars instead of 1 only for the friendly service, not for the food & drink (lack there of) really. Lastly, it was definitely overpriced.
author: Julian I.

description:
I go to this restaurant very often because the food is good and the price is really good. I love the lunch special and it's served even on Saturday.
The katsudon is also good.
author: Dwight L.

description: Really gone downhill. I want to like this place but the food is always delayed, the taste is hit or miss, and the staff is not particularly nice
author: Aaron S.

description:
To sum it up: cute neighborhood Japanese restaurant that serves good food and it's a little pricey depending on what you get.

Between two people we ate:
Agedashi tofu - it's had a good sauce on top and light crust, not how it's traditionally made but yummy and would order again

49ers roll - love that they have the thinnest piece of lemon on top so you can eat it with the roll and it's not overwhelming, would order again

Double hamachi roll - yummy, would order again

Amaebi nigiri - delicious and order only when willing to spend $$$

All in all, delicious and will frequent regularly as I live nearby :)
author: Mimi T.

description: This place is fantastic for private parities! They have a private room in the back where you can reserve in advance.  The sushi is high quality and sushi rolls are amazing! This is my go to spot in SF! A bonus is fantastic service!
author: Sunny K.

description:
Among the worst chicken teriyaki I've ever had -- dried out and tasteless. Probably grilled for lunch and reheated 6 hours later for dinner.

It's been several years since I had their sushi, so I can't speak to that. 

I do recall eschewing the salmon teriyaki some time back because it looked to be a salmon product with fake grill marks, heated directly from frozen. I thought that was only served for lunch special, but I just saw it being served for dinner, so that hasn't changed.

I'll never eat here again.
author: Crabcakes C.

description:
I was not a huge fan of Miyabi Sushi. Firstly, our rolls seemed sloppily made and relatively tasteless. Almost all of them  fell apart when trying to pick them up, which was terribly unfortunate and honestly not something I've encountered a lot of before. Perhaps the rice was prepared in a way that lacked some of the regular stickiness? In addition to that though, the rolls weren't rolled particularly tight and seemed to have a sort of loose end to them. 

Besides the presentation of the rolls though, we were not at all impressed by the flavors either. It might have been the ones we chose or just the restaurant in general, but at least for the rolls we got, we would never try them again. 

I definitely would not recommend this to my friends, and would highly suggest trying one of the other sushi places in the area (of which there are a few) before visiting Miyabi.
author: John B.

description:
I've been to Miyabi's many times over the years.
It was always pretty good.  Went there today for the first time in a while and it was AWFUL.  My husband and I both ordered the salmon teriyaki / tempura combo .   The waitress served us miso soup. 15 minutes go by. She comes back to tell us no tempura. Each of us had two tiny pieces of salmon and was charged the sane amount as if we had the tempura. On top of all this it took her about another 35 minutes to bring out our orders . Should have left after she said no tempura but we stayed because we already had the soup
author: May L.

description: Great neighborhood spot that has been around for 30+ years. Really fresh high quality fish. The yellowtail in particular is amazing. Will definitely be coming back soon!
author: Melissa J.

description: Was ordering to go and ask her to put sushi and soup separately .. guess what she said all here together. I said I don't want together because soup is hot and it will not good my sushi when I get home .. she was show me angry face and throw her pen and pick up another small bag.. thanks for a good experience first and last time here ..btw, food will be 2 stars ...
author: Zaw Win T.

description: My friend and I were here this past Tuesday.  We arrived about 30 minutes before closing and yet received warm and friendly service.  The miso soup hit the spot on a chilly night, and the tempura was just right.  I've passed by Miyabi Sushi for years and after this first visit, it won't be my last.
author: Carlos C.

description:
Friendly Service 
Yummy Udon 
Happy Staff 
Clean Place
author: Mika S.

description: Sushi is not amazing quality, especially when ordering in rolls. However, it is cheap sushi so if that is what you're looking for, then this might be the place for you.
author: Dorothy Y.

description:
Food would be a 2 stars as it is mediocre at best, clearly not fresh seafood and over-priced for that level of quality.

Overall 1 star as the kitchen staff is smoking in the staircase area at the back of the restaurant, which is immediately adjacent to the dining area. Law of physics still apply and smoke reaches everyone in the restaurant.
author: Jean T.

description:
Came here just after 6pm and it wasn't terribly busy yet. The staff greeted me friendly and got me my miso soup quickly with my rolls. I ordered some special roll and a Philadelphia roll. With some added salt the miso soup was delicious. The rolls also was amazing. He gave me the wifi password so I could watch narcos on my iPad.

Will be back.

Yum Yum.
author: Thomas S.

description: I love this place. Ive been here to meet friends and all alone. The church roll is bomb
author: Alyc H.

description: I came here for lunch. My order was taken and food was served very promptly, which was nice. The bento - tempura and salmon teriyaki, with miso soup and salad - were all lackluster. In fact, the rice was my favorite part of the meal, flavor and texture-wise. The price was also quite reasonable (only $10 before tax!) so I didn't come in with especially high expectations. Probably won't come back.
author: I Like T.

description: I lived in sf for 25 years and this place was always the worst sushi joint. The mood is glum. The food is bland. And the service average at best. If you're eyes are falling out from hunger it'll do in a pinch bit steer away if you want anything authentic or quality. Today I came in and asked if they had brown rice. Chef dude said yes. Waitress said no in the most condescending tone. Without asking or checking with anyone. Out of brown rice by noon. Well there you go.  I would have stayed and made due but she kinda capped the experience for me.
author: Kriszti D.

description: Miyabi used the be my favorite restaurant in ze world, I would go there often.  But that was two decades ago.  I've finally had to admit the ugly truth, though: Miyabi seems to have been taken over by new owners in recent years, and the food is not as good as it used to be.
author: Adam C.

description: Best bento box in the area for the money. Lunch teriyaki chicken and tempura under $12. Close to market, takeout orders are pretty quick.
author: R T.

description:
1 star, only for the lunch special value. 

This was my second time here and it was just bad. We ordered 4 lunch special bentos - 3 #22s and 1 #28 (?), and a lion king roll. Miso soup was saltier than other ones I've had. Salad was watery and my bf tasted something rotten in it and lost his appetite (probably old lettuce). Chicken teriyaki was decent. Tempura could've been better - the batter was coming off before we even touched it. Rice portions are smaller. The worst part was the lion king roll. We were halfway done with our bento boxes before it arrived and it was burnt af. The roll itself was small for what it was priced at - $12.95 (?). We asked to have it refunded and the waitress seemed super stressed out and frustrated and upset when we asked. But she kept asking if we would order something else and pushing us to have the sushi roll replaced instead of refunded. It took 3 people to tell her we didn't want the lion king roll and we didn't want to be charged for it. She took the roll to the back and we saw her talking to the sushi chef, possible owner, and another worker about it like they were confused as to why we didn't want it. The customer service was so bad - she didn't know how to handle the situation. So basically, you get what you pay for.
author: Tammy P.

description:
TERRIBLE SERVICE
* Portions sizes were too small for such prices
* Staff were disrespectful and were not tentative
* Overcharged by $5 AFTER giving an 18% tip.
Overall Bullshit
author: Quinn F.

description: Food was nothing like Japanese food at all. It can fill you up but if you want decent Japanese food this is not the place you'd want to go.
author: Hwajeong L.

description:
Attending a friends art book signing at BebeBar in the Castro on 18th/Church Street.... home to a version of the Acia bowl.  Generally speaking I keep up with cultural trends and food developments but somehow the Acia bowl slipped through my loose knit sieve of consciousness. Yep, hate to admit it but, the Acia bowl is one phenom that has slipped through those ample gaps.  Applause, I suppose for an immigrant with blond dreadlocks to create this joint, slicing fruit and dumping granola on yogurt with some "Acia" infusion. Yay! .... I guess.  

Didn't want a bowl of granola with wilted fruit for dinner supposedly made with the all mysterious and rare acia, so ventured out walking up Church Street toward Market Street. Passing a few folks hunkered down in their sleeping bags. 

Anyhoo, 2 of us landed at Miyabi:

Waitress: cold, impartial, maybe disinterested, when done eating had that "how much is my tip" look on her stoic face.

Food: The combo dinner, my sashimi was tough (a new experience for me),.. the bad cuts of a low priced slab of fish. Tempura fried in oil from the Edo period. Salad from a bag with a pungent unidentifiable dressing. Dinner guest with a safe and sane version of a bento, Teriyaki chicken. Sugar must have been on sale when they decided to make this syrupy concoction they called Chicken Teriyaki. They might try to make a new desert sensation the "protein enhanced" sweet desert - "Sweet Chicken", which most certainly would be a hit in the Castro. 

The joint is close to Market Street, so....I gotta say, there were quite a few folks with happy faces, eating @ Miyabi on a date. Other diners who threw caution to the wind and wondered in, like we did. 

Shulda gone for the Acia Bowl, and called it a night.
author: Matsuo U.

description:
With nothin to do on a Saturday night we wandered into Miyabi in search of a quick snack; we ended up stuffing our faces. 

We told our server, Danny, that our friend was visiting from out of town so he made sure we were all well taken care of. He hooked us up with edamame, hot sake and miso soup. Danny was all smiles and made our quick detour a memorable one.

The Hawaiian roll, basically a spicy tuna roll, was $4.50 and super fresh. The Godzilla roll was $9.00 and tasty. After miso soup, edamame, a Hawaiian roll, a Godzilla roll, jalapeño poppers, 3 large hot sakes and beer our bill was only $50. Such a steal. 

Will definitely came back if not for the sushi for our new bestie Danny.
author: Emily E.

description:
This review is for the quality of the Sushi and not the service. 

Spicy Tuna Roll - Fish was overly spicy and VERY dry  for a spicy tuna roll, fish was over salted which may of contributed to the dryness of the overall fish and roll. 

Spider Roll- Crab was over cooked and dry. The rice lacked flavor, and the best part of this roll was the rice and the salmon roe sprinkled on the top.

Sashimi- DRY. The fish was not fresh, and lacked texture. 

Overall, the service was good but the sushi was very disappointing. If you are looking for cheaper sushi, this is the place to go with rolls ranging from $9.
author: Kimberly G.

description:
*This is a review based on just delivered orders*

I've been getting delivery from here for a couple of weeks via Door Dash and have had nothing but good experiences. They have a lunch sushi combo with a spicy tuna and Cali roll for $8.50 (through DD) that also comes with miso soup. Order's have always been made as specified in the notes and timed well so that even after my delivery driver gets it to me, it is still warm. 

I hope to make it to the actual b&m one day but until then, I'll definitely continue ordering to go!
author: Leina K.

description:
*Warning to NOT order through Yelp for pick up*

Twice I've done so and when I arrive they said they never got the order (more like they don't check up on it) and had me wait. They must have signed up to allow people to order through the software but don't look at it until you're in the store.

Still a great sushi spot, just be aware and call the restaurant with your order instead of online ordering.
author: Danielle C.

description: Been a returning customer for 6 years, whenever I'm in the city. I love this place! Unfortunately, their prices have gone up a few dollars, which can be expected. Service is really good & food is excellent.
author: Mickey B.

description: WORST EXPERIENCE OF MY LIFE. took half an hour to get little pieces of sushi. the customer service was appalling. they were rude, slow, and unresponsive. I decided to only tip 15% because of this terrible service and they came back DEMANDING at least 18% of tip. Might I mention the food was not even up to par. the sushi was over priced for tiny pieces. I checked my bank statement and they charged me $5 more after I had already paid for the meal with tip included. this is highly illegal that they did this. never eat here.
author: Carla E.

description:
Completely respectable, relatively inexpensive sushi place in the Castro. I don't know if I'd make a special trip from another neighborhood to come here, but you could definitely do a lot worse. In this same neighborhood.

A reasonable compromise between price and quality. It's good (not amazing) and it's reasonably priced (not expensive).
author: Sean B.

description:
AVOID LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!!

In all honesty I would give this place a ZERO star rating if possible. This place has people working here who obviously hate their job and want to take it out on customers who are paying money for them to do their job. If you have terrible service you better hope your food is good, unfortunately for them they missed the mark on everything.
author: Daniel R.

description: I have been coming here for over 4 years now. It's always been fast and great! The customer service is always nice and attentive.  The quality of fish isn't bad either. I recommend if want something seafood fast to come here.
author: Ree G.

description:
This is an UPDATE to my 1 star review written back in May. I decided to give Miyabi another go, since it had been well over a year or two since I had been there last. The last time I went I had a bad experience which was MOSTLY based off poor customer service. I have never had much of an issue with food quality here, so figured it was worth giving another shot. Especially since not many places offer a bento box with EVERYTHING I want for under $15. My favorites/must haves are Salmon Teriyaki, Shrimp Tempura and tuna sashimi/maki/nigiri etc
They used to have one called the "Shogun" special but now I think it's called the 'Deluxe Salmon Bento" or something along those lines. 
I came in for lunch around 1:30/2ish on a Saturday for my birthday. The front of the restaurant was full so we sat in the back, which was pretty empty. The customer service was GREAT (compared to previous times) considering they were a bit busy for lunch. The waitress was friendly and overall the customer service was great. She checked in with us to make sure our food was okay and overall had NO issues with customer service this time. The food was pretty good! My dad got the Deluxe Chicken lunch and my only complaint would be that some bits of the chicken were overcooked and really dry. Other than that though the food was really good and the fish seemed pretty fresh. I'm actually pregnant (Yes I am VERY well aware it is not advised...but keep in mind women in Japan consume it but prob cos quality is better) so I was actually being a bit picky about where and what I ate. Call me a daredevil or crazy but I had 2 pieces of nigri and was impressed by how good the quality was, for it not being a super fancy or upscale restaurant. I've been craving maguro sashimi (my fave) for quite sometime and decided I would lt myself have ONE piece while pregnant. Was very happy with the quality and freshness. They have tons of really affordable lunch specials for about $10! I think they have at least 5 different combos to choose from? I really enjoyed my lunch and will definitely be getting this again! Really filling and great for the price!  
The one I got was $14 for the Deluxe Salmon (Or Chicken) Bento lunch, which you get the following:
- Miso Soup, Salad and Rice
- Salmon (or chicken) Teriyaki (good portion size especially for lunch!)
- 1 pc Shrimp Tempura, 4 pc veggie Tempura
- 1 gyoza 
- 3 pc California Roll
- 1 pc Salmon Nigiri
- 1 pc Tuna Nigiri

Overall was a good experience and they have definitely improved on customer service and quality!
author: Tara S.

description: Been coming here for at least 20+ years, usually for lunch. The Bento Box for lunch is reasonably priced and always tasty. I'd recommend it.
author: Tim M.

description: Fabulous sashimi:  Perfect salmon and tuna.  Rich miso soup.  Great service (thanks, Danny).  Fine salads.  Edamame needed some salt.
author: David S.

description: A cozy neighborhood restaurant with a friendly service. The food is mediocre though. The edamame was delicious but everything else lacked flavor. Wakame salad tasted funny and was borderline edible. Miso soup didn't have much flavor. Sushi was ok as the fish was not as fresh as it could be. It was a bit frozen in one roll (squid) and the yellow tail was a bit fishy. It's ok if you want a quick bite but I probably won't come back.
author: Anat N.

description:
Miyabi made me test my moral compass.

Sigh........It pains me to have to write this review, but I think it is fair to let other potential customers know what occurred during my last visit. Read on, you won't regret it.

I've been a year-long customer of Miyabi, managing to order twice a month or so. I always felt that it was a decent Japanese restaurant and was always content with exchanging my money for some of their food -- not the highest quality, but certainly not a place that I would be concerned with being unclean. PS: I'm one of those guys that has a Mother that's OCD about being clean, and so some of that passed on to me. My expectations are fairly high (though not unreasonable).

On July 23rd, I ordered by phone: Two rolls and vegetarian sukiyaki; this is my usual order. I have a little food now and enjoy some for leftovers. The order is always ready within 20 minutes, which I think is a fair amount of time. I pick up the order, take it home and start to enjoy the rolls. I work my way over to the packaged up sukiyaki, peel off the lid and find a COCKROACH soaking on top of the food. Words cannot describe how displeased I was/am...seriously, wtf.

I marched back into the restaurant and calmly told the lady at the front that there is a cockroach in the food that they gave me. She said, "excuse me?"...Of course, I repeated it once again, a little louder and pulled off the lid to show her. She seemed fairly surprised and apologized. She offered to have the kitchen make more (uh, no thanks) or give me my money back -- the choice was obvious.

This is where my moral compass was tested:

I considered going in, making an announcement to the restaurant that there was a roach in my food and offering to let people see for themselves so that they could make the decision as to if they wanted to continue enjoying their food. Honestly, I don't know why I didn't do it. I know that I would appreciate the warning if this had happened to somebody else, and for that I am truly sorry.

My two concerns:

1) There was a cockroach in my food. That's disgusting and makes me wonder what else has been in my food -- cockroach eggs? cockroach feces? Other vermin?

2) The cockroach was sitting right on top of my food (see photo). Restaurants should always pride themselves in cleanliness, but I hold restaurants that serve sushi to especially high standards. Mishandling food could cause extreme sickness and possibly death. If the kitchen let something this obvious go out to be served, what are they missing that isn't as obvious?

--

The health department inspection from January correlates with my review: High risk vermin infestation.

You have plenty of sushi options in San Francisco and at least half a dozen in the Castro within walking distance from this place. Please consider other options when you are craving sushi.
author: Ryan C.

description: This restaurant was the worst part of my visit to California. We found flies on special roll and in soy sauce. Absolutely disgusting. But it gets worse. The waitress was being rude about the scenario and trying to make us pay for food with literal bugs on it. Isn't that insane?? Do yourself a favor and try somewhere else
author: Colette G.

description:
3.5 stars in reality

Crispy and tasty chicken teriyaki, nice amount and taste of sashimi with the dinner combo and the miso soup was pretty good surprisingly. The salad, the rolls and the service were... mediocre. Not my favorite but not too bad. Plus, at least it was affordable.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Great, convenient location on Church near muni.  Came in right at opening for lunch and the place was empty.  Sat at the bar.  The staff is quite friendly.  5 stars for the staff! 
Had the Sushi Lunch, which was a little over $10. Comes with miso soup, 5 pc house choice nigiri, and 3 pc California roll.  Miso soup was standard.  Nigiri was fresh, the salmon especially good.  California roll was good.  I was still hungry so I ordered unagi.  Sweet and warm, a nice ending for my meal.  Altogether with tax and tip my lunch was $21.  I would consider this place affordable and decent quality.  I will definitely be back again when I crave sushi on the way home.
author: Audrey D.

description:
6-September, Friday
Hamachi Sashimi: was descent, although texturally a bit firm because it was over chilled. 

Spicy Tuna: the level of freshness was questionable, and a huge red flag was wavering as it was texturally gritty as if it had fallen on the ground. The tinge of disgust is still on the tip of my tongue as I think about how awful this tasted. 

Godzilla Roll: While I do enjoy Westernized rolls every now and then (in contrast to the traditional sashimi). This roll was over-fried, as it was literally still had pellets of oil running off of it. And a whole glob of spicy sauce drizzled on top of it.

Usually with places like this is even the latter of fried rolls aren't the saving grace, after compromising quality for the raw stuff. Then what is the point really? To the reviewer before me, you can go wrong with Japanese food, quite wrong actually.
author: Ty T.

description:
I was in the area since I like a nail shop near by.  My friends and I were hungry so we decided to get Japanese.  Can't go wrong with Japanese food!  

I really enjoyed Miyabi.  The restaurant was larger than I expected.  Had some sake but I can't really take shots of it.  My friends enjoyed it!  I ordered the lion king roll.  It was delicious.  I love cooked rolls with some sort of fattening ingredient to it.  It was so tasty! 

Definitely a good on the whim choice for dinner.
author: Chrissie O.

description:
Warning: DO NOT order the Combination Sashimi, especially for lunch. 1) The price listed is incorrect--it costs $17, not $11 as shown on Yelp 2) I received 3 pieces of tuna, 2 salmon, and 2 white hamachi, all exceedingly tiny. 

I could have purchased the Tuna Sashimi AND Salmon Sashimi for the same price and gotten double the amount of fish. What a ripoff.

PSA: Warakabune Sushi is practically next door, with accurate pricing and portions. I'll be going there from now on, and you should too!
author: Vrsas S.

description:
Terrific Sushi restaurant near the Castro.

Always fresh and delicious food.  Good value and wonderful service.
author: Daniel P.

description:
First time for us last night. Brad kept his attention on everything fried while I insisted on something where I can taste the fish and be somewhat healthy.  We compromised on an order of the Califlower roll and a Godzilla roll. So glad we did. The Califlower roll was straight up delicious; fresh and beautifully presented. The Godzilla roll was everything Brad dreamed of: saucy with a tempura crunch. We both loved it but Brad thanked me for focussing on the 'not so fried' and so we followed up the Godzilla with another Califlower. YUM!! 

The only thing that made my intuition-gut detector go off is when we ordered a large saki and then said Nigori and the waitress came out with one large hot saki and a large bottle of Nigori. She thought we wanted both. Obviously some miscommunication and she took back the hot saki with a little attitude. Upon looking at our bill she didn't charge us for any saki... So that made up for any awkwardness and we'll go back for sure! 

Our dinner, along with a large, cold, unfiltered Nigori, and a sprite, was heaven.
author: Roya D.

description:
always had great service by friendly staff and even free add-ons

I primarily go for dinner or take-out, have never had a problem
author: Jared W.

description:
I always get the California Roll and Ebi Nigiri because it always taste fresh and that's always great. I would definitely try out more of the menu in the future!

I've gotten the bento once and it was really delicious, huge portions, under $10. Definitely worth it!
author: Serena Z.

description: great place for pick up and super reasonable prices. It's basic sushi and rolls with out the glitz.
author: Thomas S.

description: Nothing fancy, but consistent, reliable, and tasty sushi. The restaurant is simple, but the sushi is consistently good. The staff will occasionally give us free sake if they're feeling generous, and they've even let us order katsudon off-menu.
author: Mike D.

description: Very good food at reasonable prices. Excellent value for the money. I have eaten here twice now and enjoyed it each time.
author: Ira S.

description: Excellent service. they were quick. They brought my girls their rice first, pretty much as soon as we sat down. The waitress was very kind with the girls. The sushi maker (sorry if that's not the correct term) sent little tiny baby sushi rolls to our table for them. How freaking sweet! My girls love it. I don't know if I've ever gone to a place to eat that were so considerate of small children. Food was good too!
author: Claudia L.

description: Delicious! Titanic roll is amaze. Lots of veggie rolls also. Reasonable prices and great service.
author: TheOne L.

description: This is one of my fav sushi places in the Mission/Castro. Really tasty, fair prized and great service. Highly recommend.
author: Tomce R.

description: This place aims to deceive, not please, it's unwitting customers. The menu has a section called Vegetarian Plates. The menu clearly states that all vegetarian plates are served with miso, salad and rice. I ordered the vegetable udon. My dining partner also ordered a different item in the Vegetarian Plates section. She was served miso, salad and rice, whereas I was only offered a salad. When I enquired about my missing miso and rice, I was scolded and informed the udon is never served with miso or rice. How was I supposed to know? Do I look Japanese? I was only going off of what they promised in writing on their menu. I do not have the benefit of 1000s of years of Japanese culinary heritage to know how these things work but I do recognize a lie when I see one.
author: Bertha F.

description: Ordered dinner through EAT24. Went to pick up our dinner and the restaurant stated they never got the notification for the order and therefore had not started it. The server was unapologetic and did not seem to think it was an issue, basically saying it was not his fault because EAT24 didn't call him. A bit frustrating since we are regular customers. Then we got home and part of our dinner was missing. Side note: Danny (who was not working tonight) is one of the nicest guys you will ever meet. I guess we will only dine there when he is working. :(
author: TJ W.

description:
Miyabi won't be featured on any award-winning documentaries, but it's a good, solid, affordable sushi place with friendly service, clean interiors, abundant seating and tasty food. 

Yellowtail lovers MUST try the Double Hamachi Roll. As a self-diagnosed hamachi addict, I get frustrated when the only hamachi-centric roll a restaurant offers is the hamachi-negi (because scallions are evil, foul-tasting things that should be burned off the face of the earth). It was so gratifying to find a sushi roll that offered twice the amount of hamachi and combined it with avocado (Nature's butter). The Salmon Ngiri was also pretty tasty and thankfully not made using wasabi. Cuts were rather thick and generous, and the fish was good if not the freshest I've ever had.

All of the servers were attentive and friendly, knowing when to appear and when to slip away. The sushi chef seemed a little cranky, but since I don't speak Japanese, he could have just been saying, "I LOVE MAKING SUSHI!" in a forceful tone for all I know.
author: Josephine L.

description: This is my favorite restaurant for lunch in San Francisco.  It's right down the street from work so sometimes I'm in a rush. The service is fast,  accurate,  and kind.  The food? Excellent items,  low prices combination items,  and they give you plenty of food! The atmosphere is almost like a little boutique Sushi Bar.  It's very cute and cozy.
author: Arvi C.

description:
I wonder if mediocre sushi is better than no sushi at all. The twists and turns of life have been induced by less consequential dilemmas, but I will put myself on the line and say...no, it's better to fry a catfish than have unfresh sushi.

That was the problem I was having when I decided to get a quick bite here after a Yelp Elite event at the Cafe down the street. I was thinking of going to Warakubune on the corner but didn't realize it was a sushi boat place. I don't care for those boat places since I never know how many times the uni plate has been around the flume.

Miyabi is much more of a standard-issue Japanese place with absolutely nothing distinctive about it. I was intrigued by the $2.95 Steamed Green Mussels with Spicy Sauce, so I ordered them (see my photo). Three to a plate, it was a strange barbecue-tasting concoction that would have been a better hit had I been at Minnie's, I suppose. It was so gloppy that it obscured the mussels underneath.

The $9.95 Rainbow Roll was a tad fishy, not a good sign, and the avocado sliver was completely unnecessary. Hmmm, maybe the avocado was a cover for the fishiness. I also went for two pieces of Uni Nigiri (sea urchin) at $5.50 and four pieces of Hamaichi Nigiri (yellowtail) at $7.90 (see my photo). Both were adequate, but the damage to my palate was done. Game over. A few points for the nice server though.

FOOD - 2 stars...a bit fishy...mediocre in a neighborhood that deserves better
AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...standard-issue decor like the one hundred other Japanese places you've been to
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...she was nice and came by often
TOTAL - 2 stars...pulled down by the food, I'm afraid...better to go to (gasp!) J-Town
author: Ed U.

description:
It's been a while since I write a new review, so I'll start with this one since it's long overdue.  I came here a couple of times for lunch with a co-worker when we had to do work out of the office.  Both times I ordered their lunch sashimi plate which came with four or five different types of fish.  To me, definitely satisfying for lunch purposes, but probably not spectular enough for me to consider sushi dinner here considering this area is not one I usually venture to.  My coworker each time ordered a bento box, which looks as if one can't go wrong ordering it either.

Staff has been nice during each visit, I give them credit for that.
author: H K.

description: Consistently great sushi and open LATE! Our favorite server Danny is a hoot and provides excellent service. He even sends us a text when Uni is available. Great place for lunch on a budget.
author: Dawn D.

description:
Great quality Sushi and service.  Go here with my Mom and best friend whenever in my area and want to sit down to Sushi.

I like their "Love Boat" , Sashimi/SUhi combo's.
author: Jaiden F.

description: Love this place. Was always my go-to neighborhood Japanese restaurant when I wanted something for take-out. Good value and open late. Awesome customer service.
author: Adel J.

description: Great food at reasonable prices! My combination dinner of sashimi (3 kinds, 2 slices each), tempura and gyoza was $17. Other places in town charge $20 to 30 for the same thing. The quality was great. Simpler, quieter, and more casual than the sleek, modern sushi joints cropping up in recent years.
author: Steve H.

description: I had the Titanic role and was very satisfied. I've had this item at several different restaurants and I'd say Miyabi ranks among the top third of sushi places I've been to.
author: Geoffrey B.

description:
I was looking for a lunch spot, with my sister and my dad. We came across Miyaki and decided to check it out, the interior is small but cozy.

As for the food, I had the double dragon roll, which was great, since I love eel, the roll is basically unagi on top and the inside, and some veggies. My sister had the spicy tuna salad, which I tried, to me it was pretty spicy, but I have a pathetic spice tolerance; while my dad opted for the bento box, I believe he got salmon teriyaki & the california rolls. 

Side note: I think they lost their liquor license, so anyone looking to get a drink, that ain't gonna happen.
author: Ashley G.

description: Needed to quench a mid-day craving for some good ol' sushi. Ended up getting the chirashi and it was hearty, varied, and delicious. The fish was overall fresh and pretty good but certainly not as succulent and melt-in-your mouth as more well-known sushi places in the city. If you're hankering for solid, satisfying (but admittedly not mind-blowing) sushi, Miyabi is a good spot to be.
author: Mark D.

description: Time for an update. Returned and tried the sushi. Not as amazing as the donburi. Service was over an hour and a half for 3 people for lunch. Stables were less than a third full.
author: Sonya I.

description: The food and service here is amazing. Danny was extremely attentive and gave our table the best advice on items to order. I had the veggie udon- it was the absolute perfect meal for a cloudy cool evening. We had sake and thoroughly enjoyed the great selection of Japanese beers. We finished off with green tea ice cream for dessert. I'm basically an addict for green tea everything and by far this was the best green tea ice cream ever. We will definitely come back here soon.
author: Rachel Z.

description: This place is a classic sort of neighborhood sushi spot. There is nothing fancy but the rock solid execution on sushi and AMAZING genial service from Danny made me feel like I was in one of the world's finest restaurants. Coming back asap.
author: Clayton H.

description:
Miyabi is a small, relatively inexpensive, consistently fresh, always good service, sushi bar on Church St.

I celebrated my birthday for the 6th time there on Feb 20th.

It had been awhile since I'd been there last. But I wanted to make a note that although not 5 star they are a consistent 4 star spot that u don't spend an obscene amount of money yet. Great place for a late dinner and large groups too.
author: Lisa H.

description: Do NOT use Eat24 app!! Was told estimated pickup to be 10 minutes and have not received food almost 3p minutes later. Call restaurant directly
author: Josh B.

description:
Oishi Always:
Whenever I am in the Castro, I make a point to dine at Miyabi.  I never have to wait for a table.  I like sitting in the front where the sun shines.  I am new to sushi, but I already know I like sashimi best.

Miyabi has a deluxe sashimi lunch combination that is my staple.  It has miso soup, green salad, rice and 10 pieces of sashimi.  I eat this combo without the rice.  The fish is varied and fresh, just what I want.  The price is right too.

I am here almost every Saturday, and I have never been disappointed at the experience.  The service, the food, the atmosphere, the location, the whole deal is wonderful.

I highly recommend this place for oishi fishi fun.
author: Audrey C.

description:
Nope.  No need to go back here again.  SF has too many of these restaurants that serve Japanese food for non-Japanese customers.  Menu at these places are always the same with Sushi, tempura, teriyaki, and specialty rolls.  I guess it's a good place to go for Japanese food beginners since prices are low.  

What are the problems?  Miso soup was way too sweat.  Seafood nabe used cheap frozen seafood mix found at cheap Chinese grocery stores.  Sushi quality was poor.  Saba was not fresh at all.   I ordered Sushi Deluxe, which is the highest level of nigiri, but the pieces lacked deluxe items like uni, ama-ebi, toro, nor ikura.  Quality wasn't much better than sushi at Whole Foods.
author: トモ T.

description:
The title of this review:  Poor Service!!!

We order sushi twice a month or so from Miyabi on Church Street, and I ALWAYS GET THE SAME THING!  Tonight was no exception.  Except one of the rolls I always order?  They added raw carrot to, which I cannot eat (I'm allergic to it, it will close my throat).  So we thought, okay, maybe the chef decided just to change things up a bit, we'll call them, explain, and ask them to redo it, since it's not supposed to come with carrot.  This *should* have been easy, right?

Wrong.  The woman on the phone ARGUED with us!!!  She claimed that they've always put "mountain carrot" (what on earth is a mountain carrot??  It looked like an average carrot from Safeway to me!) in this particular roll, that she's been working there a long time, the sushi chefs are the same, and nothing's different.  Um, wow.  My partner kept trying to explain to her that we order the SAME THING twice a month, and it's never had carrot in it before, and that more importantly, I'm ALLERGIC, so it's not like I've just "never noticed" before!!  Trust me, I would notice!  But more importantly, why argue with us?  We've been their customers for over 10 years!  I've brought zillions of my friends there over the years and given them good Yelp reviews.  We spend lots of cash there.  Why is she trying to tick us off???  I told him to tell her that, which he did as politely as he could muster at this point...and she continued to argue with him!  Eventually, she agreed to remake the roll, grudgingly.  

When he drove all the way back to the restaurant to pick up the carrot-less roll, she was smiley, but CONTINUED to berate him about how she was right and he was wrong!  Wow.  Incredible.  He thanked her politely for the new roll and left, because he could see there was no point in arguing, it was just beating a dead horse.  She had decided that she HAD to be right.

There are MANY other sushi restaurants in this city and we would be happy to take our money elsewhere if they no longer value us as customers.  

Dear restauranteurs (and business owners in general), when you read a bad review of your business, before you start arguing and castigating the customer, try to stop and THINK about what you're doing first.  Is it worth losing a paying, long-standing customer just because you HAVE to have the last word?  Could there possibly be a better way to address the situation, one that will end with the customer going away happy and then coming back to your business again in the future to spend more money and bring his/her friends?  

In the meantime, I'm looking for a new sushi restaurant to spend my bucks at...
author: Amy L.

description:
Miyabis broke my sushi cherry when I was about 8 or 9 years old; I am now 25 and Miyabis is still my love and home for everything delectably sushi, and I will never be able to get enough of it. I have had all kind's of crazy sushi, in all kinds of crazy parts of San Francisco, and none of it will ever compare to the love I have towards Miyabis. Call me biased all you want, hell ill even throw it in as a matter of fact that Miyabis opened the same year I was born. It's a match made in heaven and I am sticking too it. 

The sashimi is bomb, the rolls are bomb, they are open late night and they usually throw in free edimame for pick up or ice cream if your on a date eating there. The ambiance is great and the ladies are awesome. Chef is awesome too. I'v seldom had issues with missing items on pick-up, though they always make up for it with extra and many apologies. 

After take out and eat in's for many years, I can recall less than a few instances where my meal was not up to par with Miyabi's usually awesomeness. So I will always excuse. I have had experienced this with a lot of the other restaurants that I have been ordering take out or delivery for years from.

Please pay these guys a visit, they are super family and kid friendly!!! They also have a huge private party room in the back for Bday's and events. Love you Miyabi. Your my Sbom(super(sushi) buddy of mine) for life.
author: Mike C.

description: T H E Y   H A V E   S O J U ! ! !
author: Eileen M.

description: Just ordered take-out from them, and they overcharged us.  They claimed the price on their very own website was wrong.  The person helping us didn't speak very good English, and wasn't very helpful in resolving the situation.
author: Scott N.

description:
I've been coming to Miyabi for 10+ years. Despite what some of the reviews say, I think their quality has remained unchanged (that's a good thing), the service is always friendly and prompt, and they haven't really raised pricess too much. PLUS - they stay open late, which I love.

Pros: Sushi is always fresh and their sushi menu is huge, bento boxes are cheap and GOOD, their entire menu is relatively inexpensive compared to other Japanese spots in SF.

Cons: Parking can be pretty hard to find, depending on when you go. Especially after 6pm and on weekends, when there is less parking turnover.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Stopped in for a quick, very cheap lunch. Everything was fresh and tasty, but the server forgot the rice to go with my sashimi combo. No big deal, she realized a few minutes later, but we were in a hurry and it wasn't like I didn't have enough food. 

The miso and salad were nice and the fish was quite decent. The small chef's choice included ahi, which was not amazing, salmon, which was fantastic, and some other fish I couldn't identify. 

I would definitely go back - not many Japanese places are open on Mondays, and I can't think of anywhere in the city you can get such a generous lunch combination for $10 or less.
author: Sam Z.

description: Been going here for a couple years. It's a decent sushi spot. Lately I been feeling like the customer service has been cold and neglective. Sadly, I won't be coming back.
author: Chris S.

description:
unsure if it was an off night but sushi was not the greatest :(

 I realize that we are in a drought but that is no excuse for not filling up our water throughout the evening.

 Service was shitty.

 I feel bad for taking my cousin here thinking it would be a great experience.

 I can't recommend any more.
author: Athena S.

description:
I don't understand what all the kvetching is about?! 

I still love this place.  

Good price, good sushi (raw fish and cooked rolls).  

Still good service, and prices are reasonable.   And next time our li'l bro visits and wants massive amounts of good sushi, we'll take him here! :) 

It's a small location.  And parking is tight, just like everywhere else in San Francisco.
author: Fannie S.

description: Great sashimi lunch special for $12.95. Which includes Miso soup, edemame and salad. Their cold sake selection was decent bi had #4 ON llight, dry, just right for $9.95
author: David A R.

description:
THIS RESTAURANT IS NOT FRIENDLY OR ACCOMMODATING WITH DISABLED PATRONS OR SERVICE DOGS. DON'T PATRONIZE THEM.

I totally got harassed & embarrassed @ #Miyabi Japanese Restaurant on Church st & Market for having a service dog. They didn't believe me when I said he was a service dog and asked to see his license, so I showed it to them, no problem. It seemed strange because I've eaten there several times before with my service dog and never had a problem, even when they were really crowded. There were never any problems before so why now when it's not even busy?

They sat me in the dining room with everyone else and as soon as I got settled in, they returned to ask me to sit in the back of the restaurant so as not to "bother their other customers", which I did. I wasn't happy about it, but I did as they asked because I was hungry and I didn't want any problems. Before I even had the chance to get settled in, they came back again and asked me to tie my service dog in a small dark corner, on the far side of the table where he couldn't be near me and where he couldn't move, because they didn't want anyone to see him & possibly complain and they didn't want him "in their way". 

That's not providing good customer service and it also happens to be disability discrimination to treat me differently from your other customers. Any business can deny service to anyone for any reason, but if you're going to allow me in your restaurant with my service dog, you're supposed to treat me with the same courtesy & service as you would any other customer, not embarrass or make me feel bad or treat me differently. 

You're only supposed to ask if he's a service dog and that's it. I pay the same money as everyone else, so why can't I sit in the front, in the lit part of the dining room with the rest of the customers? Why do I have to sit in the back of the restaurant, by the bathroom, by myself, in the dark, where the employees are sitting?? Don't treat me like some kind of 2nd class customer because I'm disabled and require a service dog! I'm so damn angry with them!  I was personally embarrassed & ashamed to be asked to sit in the back of the restaurant like I had to be hidden away. They made a scene about it. It's a tiny dining room so everyone in the dining room was staring at us. You're not going to treat me like a damn 2nd class person and get my money. 


I'm never going back to this restaurant again and I don't recommend them at all, especially if you're disabled or a friend or supporter of the disabled. Forget trying to get a seat if you're in a wheelchair. It's too small and uncomfortable for a wheelchair. Learn from my mistake and definitely don't go here if you have an assistance dog. AGAIN, DON'T GO HERE IF YOU'RE DISABLED. YOU'LL REGRET IT.

If you take the time to read the reviews for this restaurant, you'll notice that they do have a loyal base of locals that enjoy the food and have had good experiences there. I'd been a customer for 2 years without any problems and I thought the food was reasonable and conveniently located. However, you'll also notice a lot of 1 & 2 star ratings for bad customer service, bad quality sushi and food poisoning. Until this incident, I would've rated them as about a 2.5-3 but now I wish I could give them a NEGATIVE rating. I'll also tell all of my friends about my bad experience and encourage them to go elsewhere.

Don't support businesses that discriminate against the disabled.
author: Vincent P.

description:
What a cute little hole-in-the-wall spot! It's about 4 blocks from my work and I came here as per my aunt's (SF native) request. The lunch bento boxes were very reasonably priced $6.50 - $8.50 and have a good variety of goodies.

I got the chicken teriyaki and tempura. I'm used to the South Bay's messy presentation of food so it was so nice to have small/decent sized portions that didn't look like it was assembly line food. The chicken was good but was kind of on the dry side. The tempura was the correct consistency with my request of all veggie tempura requested perfectly. The small bowl of rice was just right for me not to feel overwhelmed after eating.

The service was okay. She only visited us once and that was near the end. Our tea/water wasn't refilled, that's why I minus 1-star for average service.

We walked in at around noon on a Friday and there were plenty of seats. The ambience was peaceful with dull roar convos all around. I definitely will return and try other menu items!
author: Stephanie N.

description:
On my first visit to a sushi bar I generally order sunomono, agedashi tofu, chirashi, and maybe something from their Specials list. On this occasion the special item was katsuo nigiri.

Pacing: Poor. Miso soup and green salad (included with the chirashi) came right away from the server. Before I had finished the soup, the chef handed me the sunomono. Finished the soup and was midway through the sunomono when the agedashi tofu arrived from the server. In the midst of the tofu when the chef handed me the chirashi. Halfway done with the chirashi when the chef handed me the katsuo (I expected them to come at the same time). For most of the meal there was at least one untouched dish waiting in front of me. Arrived at 8:00 on Thursday night to a mostly empty restaurant, out by 8:45.

Miso Soup: Standard. Nothing about it stood out but it was competently made, with a few small cubes of tofu and some wakame.

Agedashi Tofu: Different. Squares of tofu, about 1 1/2" on a side, 1/2" tall, nicely battered and deep fried. There were 5 of them served on a plate, on top of a piece of lettuce, topped with a sauce like a sweet version of katsu sauce. No ginger, scallions, or broth. Reasonably tasty but I prefer more traditional accompaniments.

Sunomono: Below average. They used Asian cucumber, seeded and thinly sliced, which was nice. The dressing seemed somewhat off-flavor - not terrible but not good. The salad came with 1 piece of ebi that was not very good - grainy texture and a sort of 'old' flavor. It also came with 1 piece of what I think was akagai, which was OK quality. The dish included two orange slices, which seemed incongruous.

Katsuo Nigiri: Worst katsuo I've ever had. The fish seemed very off-flavor and it looked like it had been sitting around for a long time. Traditionally served tataki-style (seared on the outside), this fish did not appear to have been seared at all. It was drowned in ponzu such that the rice was falling apart. I ate the second piece hoping it would be better and wished I hadn't. I should have sent it back after the first piece.

Chirashi: OK. It came with about 20 pieces of 5 kinds of fish but they were cut small and thin (which I consider to be an appropriate size for chirashi) so I'd say it was about the equivalent of 10 pieces of sashimi. It also had some tamago that looked store-bought, a spoonful of seaweed salad, a few thin strips of oshinko and gobo, and a small mound of what I think was pickled plum. The fish quality was fine except for the ebi, which had the same texture and flavor problems as the piece that came in the sunomono. Plenty of rice. Standard presentation.

Shari: Great! The sushi rice was excellent in flavor and texture - just the right degree of sticky, chewy, and tender.

Condiments: Wasabi from powder, standard quality. Gari (pickled ginger) was fine. Suma (shredded daikon) was typical rotary-grater style.

Tea: Standard with sufficient refills. No alcohol currently, so no sake or beer though they both appear on the menu.

Atmosphere: Fine - clean and neat but nothing special. A lot of plastic containers and some plastic greenery in the sushi case, which I don't find very visually appealing.

Other notes: No one behind the bar or hostess stand when I came in, took a few minutes for someone to appear. At one point an older lady came from the kitchen to behind the bar, took out a plastic container of something, and sniffed at it questioningly. This did not inspire confidence. Not a very impressive Specials board - it listed toro of tuna, white tuna, and salmon, as well as the katsuo. Considering how unspecial the katsuo was, I wonder about the various toro options. No oshobori (hot towel).

Overall: OK for the price ($32, including tax) but not really worth another trip. If it hadn't been for the katsuo and ebi, I'd rank them higher.
author: Adrian S.

description: Me and my friends fav place for sushi. And the location is so fun!  I discovered it years ago. Their lunch bentos are so affordable and the amount of food they give!!!!- stuffed :)  Love Miyabi!
author: Tania Y.

description:
I come back once in a while and expect improvement, but I have not been so lucky.  There are many Japanese places in the area and they all seem to be priced about the same, but sadly Miyabi does not live up to its neighbors.  It is right by the MUNI station so maybe people don't know that much better places exist just a block away.

The chicken teriyaki seems to be a fixed item on the bento, so you would think it is amazing.  Unfortunately, it is pretty dry and chewy.  The sushi isn't great.  After waiting endlessly for our check, we just went to pay at the cashier and nobody said anything as we left.  I guess I have gotten used to hellos and goodbyes when I come in and out of Japanese restaurants.  They did welcome us in though.

Just don't get the 4 star reviews that acknowledge the bad food.  Y'all seem to have fans out there who keep coming, do them a favor- read the reviews and step up the food for them.
author: Ian E.

description: The portions are big, but the food is subpar. The chicken teriyaki I got was not cooked well and had very little flavor.
author: Sam B.

description: Fresh, lower priced sushi. $3.75 for California roll. $4.50 for ikura. Rice is sticky and doesn't fall apart. Portion size on the delicate side. Joint is run by a Korean family.
author: Griselda Z.

description:
There are two ways to eat there:
1-the cheap way: a bento box (with tempura / sushi / chicken teriyaki / salad): for 10 dollars at the most. Nothing exciting and it is just good.
2-The delicious way: order any roll (especially the three amigos rolls / baked rolls / rainbow rolls) and any grilled fish, and it is not expensive for what it is. It tastes wonderful!
author: Jinouchou T.

description:
Pros:
+ Great service -- They came by to fill up our tea quite often. 
+ Great miso

Cons:
- sushi ranged from "OK" to "kind of bad", and the sushi should be the highlight of the experience.

Summary: 
I've been here about 3-4 times now, and have never had anything better than a "so-so" experience. I believe that was my last visit.
author: Captain B.

description:
This is a go to place when all other sushi restaurants are full, but don't think it's not good. It's a block or two farther than the closest sushi place, but I can always count on it being open, quick, and have available seating.

It's simple here, nothing too crazy, but the menu is okay. You've got your regular selections. It's also super cheap, which is why I think I usually go here. 

The area is small, seating in the front near the window or more in he back. Service is ok, they usually leave you be while your meal goes on. I'm okay with that as long as I don't have to wait for the waiter to give me my check in the end.

All in all, it's not a place I urge you to go to, but it's not a place I would turn you away from. If you want decent sushi, and you just want it quick, I suggest going.
author: Andrew T.

description: Last time I went my salmon teriyaki tasted of strongly of chicken and I don't eat chicken, minus one star for that.  The sashimi and sushi was delicious.  I still love Miyabi, but I will never order the salmon again, I'll just stick with the sushi.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Barracuda is my first choice, but Miyabi is good in a pinch. The ambiance is intimate, so it's a good date place. The food is average (you won't be amazed), but the staff are really friendly and appreciative.
author: Jess W.

description:
I love this place for its proximity to my apt., never having to wait for a table, low priced, sushi, and good selection of rolls.

Our favorite rolls are the No Name, Saigon Crunch, Titanic, & Hawaiian.  In addition, there are quite a few small (non-specialty) rolls that are cheap and pretty good.  Like the mushroom roll.  

The service is fair and the location is convenient to the Muni lines off Market.  

The atmosphere is not stellar, but you likely can get  table near the window which is a cool lookout on to Church St.
author: Alexis B.

description:
Better for lunch than dinner!

I've been here multiple times for lunch and the price and taste were amazing.
Dinner, the food didn't taste as fresh and more expensive because, of course, it's dinner time...

Definitely give this place a shot. The atmosphere is cute.


Just finished our lunch today and they gave us complimentary green tea ice cream! 

Bonus points for them!
author: Vicente S.

description: It was really tasty. Watch out with the orders, they are huge. Accidentally ordered like eleven rolls.
author: Malik C.

description: I've been here three times now because I live around the corner and my husband has suggested we "just go here instead of walking to barracuda" and I've finally learnt my lesson. The food is awfully prepared, the menus are filthy, Sushi freshness is suspicious.
author: Susan C.

description:
Cheap $8 bento box lunches. 

Bland $6.50 Chicken Udon soup.

OK $2.50 Wakame salad.

Free Green tea.

Food for your stomach, but none for the foodie in you.
author: Janice C.

description: The sushi chef was both personable and knowledgeable, explaining to me the different cuts of fish and even introducing me to a new style of preparation! Who knew some garlic and a blow torch could produce such a unique flavor!
author: Mike G.

description:
WOW...just wow!

Super fresh fish, and cheap. Need I say more? I think not.

Order a few pieces of the super white tuna. It melts in your mouth like butter...
author: Miss T.

description:
This is nobody's favorite sushi place... I haven't tried everything, but what I have tried has just been okay. It's not BAD, but it's not good either, it's just kind of there, to eat. I think I actually prefer the packaged sushi from Safeway... sad...

At least you won't have to worry about waiting long!
author: Barron K.

description:
We came here for dinner because Warakabune was closed.   They have lots of interesting rolls, and the food came out pretty quickly.

It seemed fine at first, but then when we were about half way thru one of the rolls that came in ponzu sauce, we noticed that there was a fly swimming around in the sauce!  (And it hadn't just flown in or anything, so it had been in there since they brought it out.)

Ok, fine, whatever, that can happen anywhere I guess.  BUT, the problem was the waitress' response, or rather lack thereof!

She didn't even seem to think it was a big deal or apologize or anything when we told her about it and sent the food back.  She just said that "oh, it's cause it's sweet stuff, that happens.  it's not like a dirty fly, it's just with sweet stuff". 
 Umm, first of all, sweet stuff?  This is sushi here, not some dessert dripping in honey.  And second, it's "not a dirty fly"??  I didn't realize they categorize flies into clean and dirty ones, and as long as it's a clean one, it's OK.  I prefer NO flies in my food, thank you very much.  

Then when the bill came, they still charged us for the fly sushi roll that we'd sent back, which was surprising.

Something about that just seems wrong, and totally made me lose my appetite as it makes you wonder what else they think is OK.  Never coming back.
author: S. M.

description:
This seems to be our go to Japanese restaurant.  I have in reviews past commented on my inability to find the ultimate Japanese restaurant, so until I do, this place will do.  I always go for the bento combos and even add a few sushi rolls for good measure.  When going with the family, we like getting the Saigon roll or the Philadelphia rolls as appetizers.

I think it is now public knowledge that the Udon noodle soup is a joke here.  Seems the cooks at Miyabi haven't got the memo yet on how bad their soup broth is, so don't even bother.  You have been warned. Everything else on the menu is fine though.  If someone discovers they have seen the light, let us all know.

This place is also good to check out the Market Street/Castro scene.  Lots of interesting looking people walking by outside on Church Street.  Parking can be a bitch, but you knew that already.  Muni's convient enough with Church Street station close by.
author: barry a.

description:
There was a hostess at Miyabi who liked me. She would hook me up with free seaweed. I'm talking about expensive hijiki, the type of seaweed that lodges its dark green goodness in-between your teeth as you enjoy each succulent leaf. The type of seaweed that looks like a spawn of plant-life from the Florida Everglades and The Black Lagoon. It's delicious and I felt wooed.

Then the manager caught her and angrily stared at me like an disconcerted father over violating his precious daughter and bringing her home from Freshman homecoming a half-hour past midnight. I never came here again.

Takeout is a viable option when the food is served faster in a plastic bag than on a table. I can't articulate why I chose to be a takeout swine here but probably because the atmosphere is very small and often busy. I believe the few times I did eat in, the wait seemed uncomfortably long. The miso soup, edamame, seaweed salad, steamed rice and vegetable rolls are all decent options.
author: Chris G.

description: The thing I liked best about this place was the service. Our server got us seated quickly and always came by with a smile. Our tea was complimentary and our cups were always filled. As for the food, it was nothing out of the ordinary. I thought the prices we actually kind of on the higher end and most items are over $10. I was eating light so I just had a Saigon roll. It was the right amount, but I would've still been hungry if I was eating my normal amount. I actually ate more later that night. My sushi roll looked nothing like the one in the photo in the menu. The beef udon looked like something I can throw together at home and each item in the bento box looked much too small for its compartment. In general, this is just a mediocre Japanese restaurant that doesn't do much for me. I suppose it'd be a pretty quick and easy Iunch spot.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Went out Thursday night and met up with my bestie, although she was late (we can all blame Muni for that).

Best bang for the buck: Dinner Combination bento box. Salmon teriyaki-could scale back on teriyaki sauce. 

(I gave up meats(beef/chicken/pork/other birds and hippity hops for Lent).

Had a little extra: shiro maguro and ankimo nigiro.

Finally! Ankimo!

You can feel a winner here and not be too empty in the wallet!

MUNI Lines: J/22/37 just outside of door. F around the corner. 24 a block up.
author: Christopher V.

description: I would say the sushi is good and the service is good but they need to make sure they don't hand you a menu that's been scotched taped back together. The spider roll was great but we didn't care for the Dynamite roll. The Ton Katsu was tasty especially for the price. Probably would go back again.
author: John D.

description:
I always liked this place when I lived in the neighborhood.  The fish is consistently good, never great.  Popularly priced though!  Comfortable and always-available seating, but unfortunately fluorescent...  

I'd rate it 3-1/2 stars if I could, just to note the breadth of rolls, late hours and above average service. Convenient to Castro MUNI for whatever that's worth.
author: Ted R.

description:
Warm sake is always good on a cold night. The food is very affordable and the service is consistently rude but because it is open so late and is so cheap I would certainly give this place a chance.
Don't you dare ask her for extra Ginger, she may throw something at you. 
And if she brings you your bill as your appetizer is coming in, don't be surprised because she is not trying to get rid of you and besides there is no long line at the door.
That lady hates her job but those mexicans in the kitchen know how to make sushi!
Oh and the place is small so leave rowdy kids or adults at home lest you make a scene.
author: Jim L.

description:
Tons of space, incredibly cheap and delicious for the unpretentious price point ($3.50 for a deeeeeelicious Alaska roll? Yes yes yes!), great variety of rolls and reliable nigiri to boot. 

Anybody looking for a Tuesday night haunt will enjoy this place. The beer and sake also flow freely, and the service is friendly, fast and fabulous.

One more +1 for free edamame!
author: Megan G.

description: We came in here really late and looked for some Japanese food. Unlike what I read about the bad waitress the one we meet is really friendly and nice. She recommended very nice food. The sukiyaki is delicious and I love the spicy tuna and Godzilla roll.
author: keer c.

description:
This review is for their catering service only. I'm always on the hunt for quality, creative catering vendors for various catering needs for multiple meetings hosted in the Fidi. After some calling to both the Fidi location and Church street locations, I was able to connect with the catering manager (Danny). He was very accommodating to my catering needs, threw in some extras, supplied all requested essentials and delivered to the requested location on time. I was also impressed that little soy sauce dipping dishes were included and that no delivery fee was charged.

A pleasant find for your sushi party tray needs that delivers to your office in Fidi at reasonable prices and after lunch!  Sushi quality is good and service is very friendly. They deserve my business again and thought I'd spread the word!
author: Carmina B.

description: I can ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS guarantee this place will be TOTALLY TOTALLY TOTALLY disorganized. They can handle two tables. Max. Three tables and things start to fall apart. Pray that you aren't the fourth table. Please, someone open another sushi place at this intersection and put this business out of its misery.
author: Joel G.

description:
We were actually angling for some sushi boat action at Warakubune, but they are closed on Tuesdays (curse them! curse them!) and we'd already set our little hearts on a sushi adventure, so this is where we ended up bringing our sad-puppy faces.  

Tho hardly an adventure, it was good enough for second-choice Tuesday dinner.  Nothing made it shine, but nothing made it bad--it's pretty much your standard cheap neighborhood sushi joint.  By that I mean if you have to walk more than two blocks to this place, don't.  It's four from my place, and I don't see myself coming back.
author: Dana S.

description:
The food here is better than the average sushi restaurant - the chicken yakitori and the spider roll were crispy and they served plenty of edamame (well, not free though). The food was actually pretty cheap, and service was great. My most favorite part is that this place closes at 12:30AM...on a school/work night!

Get the spider roll - crispy and delicious. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Went here for lunch one day out of desperation. Almost every restaurant around this corner was closed and open for dinner only. 

And well, yucky yuck yuck... yuck. The seaweed salad, the udon, the tempura... it didn't taste necessarily awful, but it didn't taste good either. Bland and so-so... everything was an effort to eat. I felt like a fussy baby. I wonder if the Japanese waitress would be willing to slap a bib on me and say "open up for the choo choo train." Ehhh, ok maybe not.
author: Ryan L.

description:
Miyabi's, if for no other reason, gets five stars for the Godzilla Roll, which, like the name implies, stomps the living shit out of any other roll in its path. It is probably the most badass roll on the planet. It laughs disinterestedly at all other rolls. I once took a friend from Los Angeles here and he whined, "This is so far from authentic Japanese cuisine" and I slapped him in the mouth, that's how serious I am about this roll.

Aside from the Godzilla Roll, Miyabi, in comparison to the vast amounts of sushi restaurants in the city, has some of the better sushi around, and at really fair prices. Their lunch specials are priced so low that sometimes their accountant bursts through the door screaming that if they don't raise the prices he's going to quit, yelling about things like net operating income and capital gains. Then he orders a Godzilla Roll and leaves.
author: Dave G.

description:
Came here during lunchtime and the restaurant was about 50% occupied with a pretty diverse clientele. Given how many waitresses there are, I'd expect the service to be a little faster -- though one was somewhat vigilant about refilling water and tea, you go vigilant lady. 

Ordered the lunch combo. Teriyaki chicken was OK, not that super god-awful Teriyaki chicken you get sometimes that tastes like solid paste meat drowning in a sea of sauce. The sashimi was really, really small and sliced incredibly thin. Rice quality was eh. Salad, overdressed. 

Miyabi is what it is and knows what it is and I appreciate that (unlike so many Japanese restaurants that are in DENIAL. your shit aint hot so please stop pricing your bentos at like $15). 

Average Japanese food offered at a pretty fair price point. 3 stars. Done.
author: Charles T.

description:
Hmmm, I ordered the bento box special so you do get a lot of food for $14.  (9 pieces of sashimi, 2 gyozas, salmon teriyaki, tempura + edamame, soup and rice).  I really wish I can give them more stars but the fish quality was quite low.  I noticed others ordered rolls and they look decent so I would go back and try out the rolls if I'm in the hood.  

Waitress was very polite and service was prompt.
author: Yvonne Y.

description:
I love this place. It's open late. The fish is FRESH FRESH FRESH! Plus, they have my favorite sake, Hana Awaka.

The Hamachi kama is delicious, and I really like their wakame. 

Yay.
author: SisterMable S.

description:
this is my second review - and it's not good! i work right upstairs from this establishment and i MUST say that tho i love their food,the older woman that works/owns? this place is beyond rude. she' s incredibly rude and always shorts on change.  ALWAYS! the chip on her shoulder must be huge becuz she hasn't been able to shake it yet.
my 16 other coworkers and myself will definitely NOT be going to this establishment any further which is a shame when one bad apple ruins it for everyone else  - BUT just based on principal alone - NEVER AGAIN!
author: Scheherazade S.

description:
Definitely cheap eats here! I got the combo plate with teriyaki salmon and california rolls for under $7.

The california rolls were ok but everything else seemed like it had been frozen.....I mean even the green onions in the miso soup.

I've eaten their food several times before and I don't remember it being as so-so as it was today.

Eek! I may have to pass next time.
author: Tiffany N.

description: This place popped my sushi cherry four years ago and you know what they say, "you'll never forget your first." In this case its 100% true. This place is great! Its location is convenient for Muni transporters like myself and the staff is very attentive. I always come here to fulfill my sushi cravings with their Godzilla roll. Miso, tea and salads are good. And did I mention their prices are very cheap. Come here for lunch and you'll get a great deal. Love this place.
author: Kirita S.

description:
Service is prompt, food is cheap, there is really nothing I can complain about. What they lack in quality makes up in price hehe. I love how quickly they make your pick up orders! My friend and I ordered a crap load of stuff and they told us it would be ready in 10 or 15 minutes. We got there in approximately that time, and the food was already ready!

Miyabi is definitely a cozy place to bring a date or just yourself. I wouldn't recommend coming here with a ton of people because they make you order a minimum of $20 per head. Its not a lot but still. 

This place really deserves a 3.5 stars. 
-one for its being cheap
-another for how fast the food comes
-one for service
-half for location
author: emily g.

description: For lunch, this is my favorite place in all of San Francisco.  For $10 including tip per person, you can get a bento combination choosing 2 from tempura, sashimi, teriyaki chicken, teriyaki salmon, etc., with all the side fixings of salad, miso soup, rice, and 2 slices of orange.  Get some green tea, and you're set!  What more could I ask for?  Love it, love it.
author: Maile N.

description:
I am a fan of this place when I am in the city and looking to get a really quick bite to eat. 

There prices are perfect, they serve edemame as soon as you sit, and ask for your drink. This I appreciate since most places now and days seem to lack proper hospitality, 

My favorite rolls are the 49ers and the Mango with tempera battered asparagus!! Yummy both and I can eat this all day! 

The gyozas is something that I always get because they taste so freaking perfect with that little sauce. 

However, one little problem, is that there bento boxes aren't exactly the best, but this is a four star in my rating for this reason. But there rolls are solid and fresh! I would recommend if in the area.
author: Carmen D.

description: the price is okay, the quality is so-so
author: Long C.

description: Great sushi in the neighborhood. Insanely cheap lunch specials, and tasty desserts.
author: James V.

description:
Low prices, decent food and gay boy house music in rotation. 

I can't complain.

Also a good spot to head to after working out at 24 Hour Fitness on Market.
author: Miriam W.

description: The good: food is authentic and delicious.   The bad: the service.   Not very bad, but "don't expect refills on tea" bad.  There is only one waitress, but they really need two.
author: Harry P.

description:
For the longest time, my friends and I called this place "No Name Sushi" since Miyabi lacked any signage out front. Blame it on Mendocino.

Very reasonable prices that never let you leave hungry. The Uni could be better, but this can be said of 95% of the sushi restaurants in SF. A mnemonically-challenged 3rd Star goes out to Miyabi.
author: Be N.

description:
2nd Update: I'm sad to give Miyabi 1 star, but the truth is, the server was extremely rude to us and made our dining experience SUCK. We vowed never to come back again even though we love the sushi here - it's not worth it. 

Update: We came back here and noticed they played really good music. Also - we ordered sake and there was a piece of red pepper in it and the server refilled our entire bottle for free. She hooked us up! It was awesome! 

Oh and the Saigon Crunch roll is awesome!!! 

My boyfriend and I came here last nite from a friend's suggestion. They sat us in the front of the restaurant right next to the window which was nice. There was only one server so when the restaurant picked up, we had to wait for a bit for tea refills and our check. We ordered: 

Tempura - not that great. They used all american veggies - carrots, broccoli, onion, potato, but did have the traditional shrimp. I was disappointed because I like sweet potato and string beans instead of carrots! 

Great presentation for sushi - they were all very colorful and looked delicious. The portions were also big. They give you a lot of fish and rice in each roll.

Maguro - (tuna)  very shiny looking but didn't taste that great
Tamago - (egg) definitely not the best, freshest egg omelet
Pocky - (spicy white tuna with onion) this is the BEST one - very yummy
Dynamite - (spicy tuna fried in tempura batter with tuna and tomiko on top) OK, it was wasn't great but it wasn't bad
49ers - (California roll with salmon and a small slice of lemon on top) This was a treat - the lemon brought out a great taste in the California roll. 

Overall, the sushi was good - there are definitely some good rolls and the service was ok.
author: Gladys C.

description:
Came here on a date this afternoon. After walking around all afternoon looking (unsuccessfully) for a Thai restaurant that was open for lunch, we were just happy to have a place to sit.

We ordered a few rolls (49er roll, tempura roll, Philadelpha roll, and spicy tuna thing) for our lunch. I enjoyed what I had, but was kinda surprised to see they didn't include salmon in their Philadelphia roll. Nothing to complain about, though!

It wasn't the best Japanese place I've been to, but it made for a nice little lunch.
author: Chris C.

description: A solid sushi place, the magic is its open till 12.30am. 10.30am on Sunday. They have generous portions and its inexpenisve. I had saba nigri the other night and it was very good. California rolls are moist and tasty.. I had forgotten about this place until i was searching for late night dinner after work the other night. Go here its quite good.
author: Madrone H.

description:
I've been coming here for about 3 years.

Service has been consistently good, they also open late.

Fairly priced. Lunch is much cheaper than dinner, but they all fill you up! Also have good soju cocktails.
