Food quality is good. I usually get the salmon teriyaki & sashimi combo box, but also love their sushi nirigi combo and rolls. The salad dressing used to be the bomb, but they kind of lost the flavoring in past year or two. 

Quick note on their soju cocktails: you are never able to order whatever you want! When I wanted yogurt soju, they ran out of that and so I got a strawberry instead. Last time I went there, they had neither choices so I had to go with cucumber. They are all good cocktails, just have a very limited selection.
author: Ian W.

description: Very good lunch spot, excellent lunch specials and good price. No compaints at all with the terriyaki chicken and california roll that I ordered. Very clean and pleasant dining experience. Would highly recommend this spot.
author: Ronette B.

description:
This little gem tucked away on Church Street is certainly fantastic! We went to Miyabi for dinner tonight and were very happy with the quality and service. 

When you're walking into the small restaurant the sushi-chef's all collectively say, "irashaimase" - which is "welcome" in Japanese. It really is a small but kind detail that made us feel welcome and invited upon arrival. 

We ordered the Shrimp Tempura Meal (A+), California Rolls (A+) & The Crazy California Roll (A+). All were well prepared, non-greasy and very tasty! 

I wasn't incredibly moved by the miso soup, but at $1.00 a bowl, what can you really expect? The waitress was positive and friendly, and in such a small setting, the personalized attention to details and service are omnipresent. 

When leaving Miyabi all of the chefs kindly say, "arigatou gozaimashita, mata kite kudasai" - which means "Thank you, Come Again!"

Fantastic!

Definitely recommend this place for small groups and late Saturday night eating (as they are open till 12:30am).

:)
author: Carlos H.

description:
it was ok.. the rolls are huge - which I don't like..

With so many other fabulous sushi places in the hood.. i give this one an ok..
author: Monica S.

description:
Miyabi is absolutely my favorite sushi place in SF and I've been around the sushi block once or twice in my day.
The food is always fresh and delicious and the prices cannot be beat. What's more, the staff is extremely friendly and all around wonderful. This place has it all!
author: Virginia W.

description:
I LOVE MIYABI!!!

Great prices, great food, and great quantity.  

Most meals include miso soup, rice, and salad.

Fast service
Great for groups
Usually no wait for a table (even when arriving with a large group)
Open late.  (midnight I think)
author: Lani P.

description: I love this place! Definitely my favorite sushi place in SF. Very clean, prompt, and food is always hot and fresh when served!
author: Marilyn D.

description:
LOVE IT.
We spend $50.00 for 2 beers, a soda, 2 rolls, order of spicy tuna and 2 orders of Unagi.  For the kid we order Teryaki chicken from the appetizer section and ask them to leave off the vegetables, just meat on a stick.
They serve two big portions of the chicken.  We had Fried Tofu and a Seaweed Salad.  Too much food. SO good.  We have been enjoying this place for years.  Each time we go we have been trying to control what we order because we really stuff ourselves.
Service is friendly and very kind.  We even scored parking right out side
which is rare for San Francisco eats.
author: Ari L.

description: food continues to please and the service is attentive.  i never have trouble getting a seat here.  My neighborhood favorite.
author: John A.

description:
Three stars is just what this place is: A-OK. It's not a bad place. I wasn't disappointed or anything. I think there might be too much emphasis placed on four and five stars sometimes. It was clean and fresh enough, especially for the price. I'm glad it's in my hood and I can see dropping in for quick and casual dinners every now and again. It's just not a four star place. It is sufficient. Not romantic or innovative or memorable in any other large way.

It's A-OK.
author: Will R.

description: Always Excellent! I live on the same block as this place and come here a couple times a week. It's quick and easy, always tastes great and the service is the best. I recommend their bento boxes as well as the 49ers roll!
author: Juan T.

description: Decent. Not a place I'd go out of my way to eat at. The sushi tends to be ice-cold and often a little too mealy.  The service is pleasant, if rushed.
author: Mike M.

description:
Clean, cheap, open late (until 130AM on Friday for sure!), friendly service, cash or credit, spacious and no nonsense... sounds like a guy I once dated.

Anyhoo! I've found myself with my nose pressed against their glass windows too often for my own good. So, here's the skinny in my own fine words.

GOOD WHEN:
1. You're lazy and cooking don't thrill you much... and the pay cut due to your furlough ain't helping
2. You're looking to go on a first-second-third date... and its too early for that 3-week anniversary meal at Boulevard
3. You're watching your wallet and don't want to spend a butt load on Warakabune and their sushi boat... unless he/she pays
4. You're a bit tipsy after taking in the senior special at The Pilsner and need to carb up... and bring your senior with you too!
5. You're tired of waiting in line at Chow's and you're seeing spots from low blood sugar... or coz your collar's too tight around your neck
6. It's midnight on Friday night and you're REALLY NOT wanting to go to Sparky's... coz you've been there and done that and its a no! no!
7. You just want to hang out with a friend (s), catch up, chat and are not looking to go all out... again, unless he/she pays

GOOD FOR:
1. Combination Dinner Boxes at $11 a pop are filling coming with soup, salad, rice and whatever combination you picked
2. The Love Boat (I know! It's hilarious and comes in a boat) is a good deal with a nice variety of sushi
3. Good old Japanese beers and saki (both hot and cold... like Kate Perry)
4. Gyoza
5. Oshiashi (boiled spinach with sesame seed) is nice
6. Tempura Donburi is worth checking out

All in all, if you want simple Japanese that is cheap, quick, open late and a hop-skip away from Muni, this place is worth checking out.
author: Amit S.

description: I love this place. its soooo good so fresh. I order the miso soup and its always sooo good!!!! The sushi is the best! i love it here.
author: Betsy E.

description:
3 Stars. Would probably give it a 3.5 if I wasn't comparing it to Warakabune, a block down the street. 

The two of us each ordered albacore nigiri, which was just okay. It was fresh but the pieces were not very big and it wasn't as buttery delicious as I've had most other places in San Francsico.  What Warakabune lacks in roll selection, Miyabi certainly makes up for.  We ordered 5 rolls, which was way too much food, but we wanted to try it all since it was our first time. I especially liked some spicy tuna with tempura crunch roll and the crazy roll.  Good variety of rolls, something for everyone.  Prices were moderate. 

If you want rolls, come here. If you want fresh nigiri or sashimi, walk the extra block and go to Warakbune.
author: kate m.

description: The food is still as good and great value as ever. But there's a new waiter who is truly terrible. He's impatient to take your order, as soon as you sit down, tries to push you into ordering what he thinks you should have. Then he decided independently to change what we ordered and had a really hard time putting it right. To finish off the evening he asked "are you finished with your meal" and when I said no he put someone else's plate on top of mine and took it away. He's the slightly chubby Asian guy. Avoid him and you'll be fine.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Woh. 

I just found out this place is open past midnite! Talk about the icing on the cake! NICE! I've always dropped by this place for lunch. Great price, good portions, fresh fish. Here and there for dinner. Always I left Miyabi satisfied with no complaints. 

Some nights after work when I'm with the lady, I find myself craving sushi and wondering where I can go. Few places that come to mind are super expensive, or super Sh*tty if you get what I mean. To know that this place is open past midnite makes me want to do a hand stand! Especially since I work till 10pm+

I'm sure I will be frequenting this place more often now.
author: Tip S.

description:
Not only is it overpriced, but the sushi is awful. Even the soy sauce is incredibly salty and terrible.

Perhaps it was just an off night, but man, not good.
author: K F.

description:
It's ok for a late night Japanese place. I came here at midnight with a friend because their open sign was still lit up, but they refused to seat us and told us they had closed (even though closing time said 12:30). We finally ended up getting food to go.

The tempura udon was meh. The noodles were way overcooked and the tempura was too breaded. The gyoza tasted bland. My friend's sashimi dinner looked strange - he ended up not eating all of the sashimi because fish quality was questionable.

I wouldn't come here again and it was pretty damn expensive.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Great service& food most of all freshness!
My favorite roll was double dragon roll!  Tempura and fried Tofu was yum too~ Fresh sashimi was outstanding. Overall great food,service,reasonable price, I will go back again.
author: Sook K.

description:
I have just moved to San Francisco and have been looking for a good sushi place to go ---- and finally found one!
I have been to many many many sushi restaurants - and you can rely on my comments here.
First of all, GREAT price. Actually slightly less expensive compare to other sushi places.
Cute interior - waitresses are very very friendly - their appetizers are yummy - especially the warm aged tofu and 
fresh tempura place!!!! - my favorite.
The sashimi and rolls are delicious and very very FRESH - my favorite was the DOUBLE dragon roll! Must try! 
On a rainy day like today - it's a perfect place to go and warm your stomach with some hot Sake and say hello to sushi and more~!
author: Super S.

description: REALLLY good food!!!! Had the baked salmon, and my friends had the lion king and some other rolls. They were all SOO tasty! The service was amazing too!! Will definitely come back!
author: Olivia S.

description:
Ive been here a few times since writing the below review but I went back today and the new waitress wouldnt let me sit where I wanted to.  There were only two tables full and I wanted to sit at a larger table since I needed to do some work.   I decided to leave and never return. 

--------------------
Ummmm.... can I have some sushi with my SALT?  Holy cow, I dont know if they use cheap soy sauce, too many salted sesame seeds, salt in the wasabi... the rolls here are so salty that its not even a pleasant cheap sushi experience.   Granted its not as bad as Sushi Club... deep underneath all the salt I believe there to be truly mediocre sushi vs. just truly bad sushi.   Ill give them two stars because I had a Godzilla roll and it wasnt half bad.  Now, somebody please pass me some water.
author: Bigfrog W.

description: My first visit here I was expecting a lot. But the reason for going was the late night hour. The salmon tasted fine. However, I don't know the service was pretty sketchy. There was 4 of us and somehow the bill came out to $80? I think we got jipped! Two days later came back with the family and they said they had no kids menus, interesting I read them 2 days ago! They sat us waaaay in the back next to the bathrooms and never came back to check on us. I was eyeing the employees and they were eating in the front, not knowing we wanted to order more California rolls. Ah I'm cool-this isn't the spot for late night sushi!
author: Marie P.

description:
Great prices on vegetarian rolls and fair prices on special rolls, but nothing to make me feel this was anything other than a pedestrian sushi experience.

The seafood rolls came up a little lackluster. The eel in one of my rolls seemed to be mostly crispy skin and the sauce was less like a hint of BBQ sweetness and more like a melted lollipop. On the other side of the spectrum, the crazy-cheap Japanese plum roll was a perfect blend of salty sour and sweet.

Next time we visit San Francisco, we're checking Yelp for a more "foodie" joint...but if you're in the neighborhood and want a nice, reliable sit-down experience, try Miyabi.
author: Keith S.

description:
I ate here on a Thursday night after a long day at work looking forward to some good Japanese food.  Instead I got some mediocre food at best, and a really rude waitress.  I paid for my meal expecting a couple of dollars back in change.  When the waitress picked up my check, she didn't even bother to ask me if I needed change back so I waited patiently for about 20 minutes...still no change. So I go up to the register where she was standing and asked her if I could have my change.  She had the nerve to look at me all crazy and say 'Oh I thought you included your tip' to which I replied 'I am going to give you a tip, but I wanted change back first.'  So she grabs a couple of dollars out the register with attitude and places it in front of me without saying anything. So I leave a dollar for her without saying anything or without looking at her.  

She's lucky to have even got a tip.  

HERE'S A GOOD TIP:  DON'T EAT HERE.  There are PLENTY of other JAPANESE RESTAURANTS in the CITY with BETTER FOOD AND BETTER SERVICE.
author: jason c.

description: I have always have good customer service here.  Maybe because we always go as a big group with co-workers.  I think their chicken teriyaki  could be more tender, it is on a dry side.  There bento box is nothing speical but reasonable priced.  I can see why they are not busy because as for most tempura item in other Japanese restaurant, I have seen more generous portions. They only have 1 shrimp in their tempura in their bento box.    They have smaller  CA rolls in the past. as I remember  are very tiny.  Now they are much better and bigger.  I think they are trying to be better to compete with so many good restaurants in the area.
author: Mar H.

description: Decently friendly service, prompt seating, and late hours do not make up for the poor sushi quality. They were rolled sloppily and did not taste fresh. The tempura was luke warm and appeared to be microwaved from when it was fried earlier. The seaweed salad was unappealing. I've tried this places a few times before, and it seems I will not be going back.
author: Lauren D.

description:
I've been here numerous times over the years (dragged out by friends on birthdays or dates) and I have been disappointed every time. 

The rolls are nothing special, underwhelming at best. The tastelessness of the rolls do not coincide with the price. Depending on the cook, the Bento boxes are either overfilled with unappetizing portions or lacking and a total rip off of your money.

Service is also sparse, even on a quiet night.
author: Manny V.

description:
It was a toss-up between Crepevine and Miyabi today, but I have been in sushimania lately. The place was empty around 5:00, so I had a seat at the bar and got a few rolls. My server was very friendly and told me what her favorite rolls were, and the chefs each made half of my order to get it to me sooner. The pieces were larger than most sushi bars, so I was full and happy by the time I left. 

Order:
Rock N' Roll (6pcs) x2
Spider Roll (6pcs)
$16.20

Party:
Just me

Prices:
Fair

Service:
Fast, friendly

Will I visit again?
Probably, with friends.
author: Taylor S.

description: Was craving Japanese food today so decided to find an affordable place to check out. Decided on take out since it is quick. I got the chicken teriyaki and tempura lunch combo. For about $8 you get a large portion of chicken in syrupy teriyaki sauce goodness. The tempura was ok. Rice was soft and fluffy and salad looked fresh and dressing was mildly flavorful. If you are looking for dependable and affordable Japanese food, then drop by... I'd come back for more..
author: Thomas L.

description:
This place is consistently good for the price.I've been a customer for 4 years and I always find good service, great food and a nice atmosphere.
The bento boxes are cheap, and they carry some crazy rolls.
author: Daniel S.

description: This place is not too expensive and the sushi tastes good. I really like this place.
author: Joe V.

description:
The worst piece of fish I've ever eaten in my life was served at this place.

I had their Sushi Lunch ($7.95), and I truly regret ordering it.  California Rolls were just OK, but some of nigiri looked really sad.  I usually love Hamachi, but this one tasted like something frozen for a couple of years, defrosted, and sitting in the glass case of the sushi bar for a couple of weeks.  The after taste of the fish was so nasty that I had to eat a whole candy bar afterward.  

I'm not a sushi snob who would not eat sushi in inexpensive places, but this one really made me reconsider my position.  Eeeeek!!!
author: Ryoko M.

description: Can you say sketchy? This place sucks hard. I've avoided it for years because it always looked marginal to me. Then my friend took me there and I caved. Big mistake. I was served a roll that had rancid avocado on it. When I tried to return it they refused to take it back saying that they get their avocado fresh daily. "I don't f-ing care if you picked it off the tree. The avocado has passed and it's now rotten. Look at it, it's brown."  The people that run this place are serious idiots. Avoid it like the plague.
author: benjamin p.

description:
I hate cooking for one. It means you will definitely have leftovers AND dishes to deal with all by yourself. No thanks. It's take out sushi time. =)

Raw fish can be a hit or miss and last night I just wanted a sure thing. I can always count on sushi rolls with a combo of eel and/or avocado so that was my game plan. 

I called up Miyabi, told them I'd be there in an hour and ordered: 

Double Dragon Roll - eel and cucumber on the inside and tobiko, avocado, and more eel on top. Everything I love in one roll! 
Rock N' Roll - eel and avocado roll. Always good. As reliable as a side of french fries.. 
Spider Roll - Soft shell crab, avocado, and tobiko. Sometimes the soft shell crab is really small and sad but it was a pretty big here. Hot and freshly fried too. I'm happy! 

Affordable, convenient sushi. That's all folks!
author: Julia T.

description: I am highly allergic to MSG, when i asked if i could get my order without, the waitress said that everything on the menu had MSG.....so I left and i will never return.
author: tony n.

description:
Wins award for worst bowl of udon ever.  Great job.


Stay away from korean sushi restaurants. 

===Edit====
Later that night... horrible stomach ache.
author: Rion S.

description:
I know nothing about sushi.  I mean, it's vaguely ethnic and not deep fried, so you know, not really my thing.

A friend was like "meet me at Miyabi on Church" and I was like "jigga what?" and he was all "you know, the sushi place that is still representing for the 80s inside."

And you know what?  This place was totally rocking big hair, hoop earrings and shoulder pads.  +1 star.

We ordered way too much food.  There wasn't enough space on our table for four!  I LIVE TO EAT.

I thought the rolls we ordered were good but the binto box wasn't anything special.  I mean, if you're in the neighborhood and craving sushi this place will do.  Apparently there are better places nearby but I wouldn't know much about that.  Hmph.
author: Evan L.

description:
Miyabi is simply one of the friendliest and most trust-worthy sushi restaurants in my book. 

I go to Miyabi at least 3 times a week and in addition to their kind, friendly staff, I have never had any kind of concerns with the freshness of the food. Service is prompt, yet not intrusive.

I really can't say enough great things about them.

Oh! and they're open until VERY LATE, unlike other places.
author: Alex K.

description:
Don't try to be cute & order nigiri because trust me, it sucks. Just order the big giant for american fatty rolls. It's okay. Really. You'll feel better. 3 stars because they're open fairly late (until 11:30, I think) which is very nice for me. 

Anyway, the first time I came here (in 2003) it was on a date with a person who spent the majority of their life in Japan. Now that I'm a much more experienced consumer, I really have to wonder what the fuck he was thinking by bringing me here. You really have to watch out with those people you meet on Craigslist.
author: Maria D.

description:
We stumbled in while wandering the neighborhood and walked out with one of the best food highs I've ever had.  Granted, this was my first sushi on the west coast, so I expected a treat, but this was above and beyond.

We were the first to arrive as they opened for dinner, and sat at the bar.  The executive chef was working, and was very friendly and welcoming, chatting with us as we ordered and tucked into our appetizers.  Service was attentive and efficient.

Tempura, salad and gyoza all struck me as okay; nothing to write home about but not what I judge a sushi bar by.  The miso was aromatic, flavorful, and just the right consistency.  The seaweed they use for their rolls stood out for its flavor and texture, the kind of attention to detail that tells you someone is really paying attention.  Presentations were traditional, not overblown art nouveau visual confections like you get in some trendier places, just good quality well-made sushi and sashimi.  Even the pickled ginger and wasabi were noticeably high quality.

The fish... Oh my goodness, such fish.  The uni, white tuna, and salmon were all the best I've tasted.  The chef recommended monk fish liver, which I'd never tried before, and while it won't displace my favorites it was an exquisite experience all the same.  I don't often leave a sushi bar feeling stuffed, but I couldn't have touched another bite, and the final price, for appetizers and soup/salad/entree for two, was surprisingly affordable.

For two Chicago natives, sushi of this quality and value is a rare treat, and I wish I could come back again and again.
author: Michael J.

description:
Not extraordinary.
Not horrible.

Adequate sushi/sashimi.

The lunch menu is pretty decently priced - $6.95 gets you sashimi, chicken teriyaki, rice, soup and salad.  Not bad.  The sashimi is fresh (though cut very, very thinly.)  I also ordered the Hawaiian roll (aka, the spicy tuna roll) which was... adequate.

I think that there are better places to get your fish on if you're a true sushi/sashimi aficionado... however, if you are truly jonsing for some fish & Miyabi is the only place you can find... adequate.
author: Kate R.

description: Got the sashimi meal with 7 slices of sashimi (which would have equated about 3-4 slices  at any other restaurant), with salad, soup, and sushi rice.  This meal was pretty mediocre and definitely over priced for what you got.  I'm willing to give this place another shot and try their sushi rolls.  I'm staying away from the sashimi next time.  The fish probably would have tasted better if it was masked and doused with other sauces and veggies.   You'll get your value from a bento box/ California sushi style meal here.
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
Simple and Sweet.

-Cheap FTW (for the win)
-Good
-Hardly a wait.
-ToGo always ready on time.
-Friendly

Done.
author: John C.

description: Looks mom and poppy, but the fish quality was surprisingly excellent. What more do you need?
author: Charlie Bolognese Z.

description:
It WAS good. I had the Samurai dinner which included sashimi, chicken teriyaki, shrimp/vegetable tempura, gyoza (2 pcs.) along with miso soup, salad and rice. My sister ordered some rolls, which weren't anything spectacular but still good.

My sister had one of my gyozas... told me it tasted rotten and that I shouldn't have eaten it. And yes, I did get a really horrible stomach ache after dinner... I sure paid for it later that night on the toilet. Never, ever again. :(
author: S. D.

description:
I've only tried the sushi which was pretty good, but nothing I would go out of the way for. Service was mediocre. A customer thought I worked there and motioned me to seat him (!!!). The women's toilet was clogged with logs. 

I wouldn't really come back unless someone was paying for me. It is, however, better than that nameless sushi spot across the street, which I wouldn't go to, even if someone paid for me.
author: Zell C.

description: I've eaten here many times over the past few years and have always had generally good service and good food.  The decor isn't anything too exciting but the sushi and rolls are of mid/high quality, generous portions, and reasonably priced.  The house hot sake is also nice and tends to taste even better as I drink more.
author: Kent W.

description:
Not bad.  Not good.  A-OK.

Last time I was here, my friend tried the Nigiri Dinner, I tried the Tempura Dinner and I also ordered Salmon and Lemon rolls (Forgot the name already.  Urk.)

The tempura was disappointing but maybe it was my fault for not ordering sushi.  The roll was decent.  The salmon was relatively fresh.  
I guess the price was OK and the quality was OK.

But OK gets three stars.  See above.
author: Aron L.

description:
Hmmm. I'm reading the other reviewers and I'd say this place is no different from the other mediocre sushi places in the city.  I used to live a few doors down from here, would order pick-up or stop in every now and then and i've never really left feeling like they had good food.

How do you know when a place has good sushi?  When you get more fish than rice, meaning, they SHOULD NEVER pack on inches and inches of rice in your rolls or nigiri.  And sad to say, a LOT of sushi places in city do this. I call this cheating.  I'd say for amateur sushi eaters, they wouldn't mind or even notice, but I wouldn't qualify myself as an amateur anymore and good sushi is hard to find in the city.  The fish was not fresh and the food was just ok.  The wait staff have never been attentive or pleasant, sometimes, a little brusque.
author: I love t.

description:
My favorite cheap sushi spot- you can buy rolls for $3.50. I love the spicy tuna, shrimp and avocado, and rock n roll. Basic stuff, but pretty fresh and delish. I'm not into all those crazy fried concoctions Americans love so much. 

Small and a nice atmosphere.
author: Christina S.

description: Ug, you know the last time I was here I noticed everything seemed to have taken a dive.  Maybe it was just a bad night, but it was really some of the worst sushi I have ever had.  Snapper and Yellow Tail were really not fresh.  It was very disappointing.  And I can say definitely the worst uni of my life!  It was quite literally hard to swallow, disgusting.  I'm really not sure what they did to it.  I'm going to shop around for new sushi places.
author: Luke M.

description:
Please don't give this place business. I used to come here years ago, when I lived around the corner. The first 5 times, it was good/okay. You know, good for a bite after work. Decent sushi, comparitively priced with the neighborhood, and a special treat to myself during my financially scrappy years.

The 6th time must have been a charm, or omen. I ordered the sashimi, which the chef decided to slice paper thin. For the price they charged, I swear it looked like 3 slices were cut from one normal sashimi slice. I asked the server if this was the usual serving and she flew into a tirade at me arguing. She told me that this is how it's served in Japan. Huh??!!! I've had sashimi all my life, and in Japan, as well, and it was never like this. I shouldn't have lost my cool, but her instant outburst pushed my buttons.

The server proceeded to talk out loud to the chef in Korean obviously berrating me. I've not gone back since, and checking out the reviews here for the first time, it's apparent I'm not the only customer fallen victim to their service.

If you're hankering for sushi in this area, go to Warakabune down the street, or Hanabi near Haight & Fillmore. Better yet, check out Sushi Zone tucked away on Market & McCoppin (totally amazing if you can get in). Miyabi, thumbs down....
author: Antoi C.

description:
Ok. Just ok. 
If you think this is great sushi that is in itself just really sad.

I don't hate it here. I don't love it. I simply just won't go back due to so many other and vastly better options in the area.

(Swear to god the sentence above was also uttered by an ex gf about me.......)
author: Rich S.

description:
Miyabi has a friendly waitstaff that seems eager to please.  Too bad the fish isn't good and the miso is thin and tasteless -- two things waitstaff cannot change.   

My husband and I split a sashimi plate, Cali rolls, and ama ebi.  Fish was just so-so, unpleasantly soft to the bite and lacking flavor.  Not worth the price.  The fried shrimp heads were greasy and tough.  And I hate dyed pink ginger!  

1/2 star for waitstaff, 1 stars for cozy ambience, cleanliness, and being open late, 1 star for offering real crab California rolls  (but you lose 1/2 star for having that by request only).  I wouldn't go back unless someone was treating, and I think I'd probably just get a California Roll.
author: saudade s.

description: This is a really good place for sushi. Very pleasant atmosphere, comfortable, not too fluorescent as these joints can sometimes be... really friendly staff... really fresh fish. This is way better than the place down the street with the boats.
author: Michael C.

description: The service was lovely. The food, however, was very disappointing. It was strange how fast it came, too. Before I could even have a few sips of my miso soup my rolls came to me. They looked sad. The fish looked as though it had been in the freezer then put in a blender and formed around the rice. It was mushy in a bad way, and not fresh. My boyfriend's dinner box was similarly foodcourt quality. Perhaps Sunday is a bad day to get sushi because the fish isn't fresh?
author: Mark S.

description:
I think the ridiculous house music is actually better than the sushi, but I'm not positive.

Acceptable, not stellar sushi at good prices.  You can usually get a seat quickly as well.
author: Steve S.

description:
Pretty nice place to go for Japanese food.  

Smaller tables up front while the larger family tables were in the back.

I enjoyed the service I get when I go there.

The food is pretty good, not really the best, but a lot better than some places I have been to before.  I love their Chicken Katsu.

It's nicely priced, especially if you go during lunch.
author: Mike V.

description:
One step above Osaka Sushi in the Castro, mainly because Miyabi is cheaper, but also because I boycotted Osaka since last year. Miyabi  has been around for years and years, and they do know how to run a Japanese restaurant.

The starters are fine, and the seaweed salad is just as good as any in the city. The rolls are pretty much average but inexpensive, and the sashimi dinners are perfectly fine, especially for the price. 

Don't expect to be floored by the experience here. That's kind of a pun, because the floor was recently replaced or refinished. It makes the place much brighter and inviting. The staff usually distributes plenty of smiles in your direction, which is a nice departure from being served by zombies.  Try this place out a few times.
author: Daniel C.

description:
The sushi here might not be what you'd find in Japan, but it tastes great. I went for a friend's bday. We started the meal off off with 2 bottles of hot sake ($5.50 for 4 or 5 servings), a complimentary order of edimami, and two bowls of seaweed salad. Mmmmmm...seaweed salad.

If you don't know what to get, order one of these:

unagi & avocado roll ("Rock 'n' Roll")
deep fried asparagus & mango roll ("Church Roll")
fried spicy tuna roll ("Dynamite Roll"")

...or order something else. It's all good here.

At the end of the meal, they served up a few complimentary green tea ice creams.

Great service. Great food. Great prices. Great for groups.

I'm going back.
author: Wes F.

description: The service was good, but the food was Awesome.  Promptly greeted and seated.  We were given the perfect amount of time to decide and was served each course with enough time to enjoy before the next one was brought.  My only complaint is that I had to wait a bit for drink refills, but other then that it was a perfect meal for the price!!!
author: Rikki S.

description: The rolls are scruptious. Try the flaming cali roll or the firecracker! The 49 er is always a favorite. The atmosphere is a little bland but the friendly staff make up for it. There are several locations in SF so stop by and try one yummy sushi spot.
author: Alex S.

description: This place is pretty good. The service is okay, the food is cheap and the place has a cozy atmosphere. I think this place is more suitable for a 2-4 people kinda dinner, since the place is pretty small and is just convenient for a small gathering dinner party. Another thing what i like about this place was how fast they serve your food. Usually in any other restaurants, i would have to wait for about 20 minutes, but in Miyabi they serve it to you in only 15 minutes. Pretty amazing, i would say. However, the food is just so so, didn't complain but since the price is pretty cheap. i gave three stars for it.
author: Cavin T.

description:
Miyabi is perfectly fine.  It's open late.  And it has a great mango and deep-fried asparagus roll.  

And its a nice place.  The food is nice.  The place is nice.  We enjoy it when we want a step above No-Name, although it's not super cheap.  Just cheap.  And nice.  The pickled vegetables are really nice.
author: Nicole and Kayvon B.

description: Awesome place and awesome rolls. Sunny our server was quick and very polite. Must try the no name roll the next time you are around the neighborhood. :)
author: Lynne E.

description:
Ended up here by default because I was craving udon? The sushi is really, really average but not gross. The service is good, but the food is pretty basic. Then again, you get what you pay for. 

This isn't bad for udon and donburi, but skip the rolls!
author: Emily C.

description:
My boyfriend and I just had dinner here and thought we should write a review because this is actually the first restaurant we liked in San Francisco. We just moved here from the NY and have a difficult time finding a descent place to eat, with friendly service.

The wait staff was very friendly. The prices were great, and sushi rolls were excellent.
author: Gina H.

description:
upon learning that there is a place that dishes out korean, i was ecstatic for some bibimbap for lunch. but again, fidi eateries defeated me. 

for $9.80, i had a bibimbap with bulgogi ($2) and an egg sunny side ($1). this is the first time i've had a bibimbap that did not have any sort of broth drizzled on the rice before topping the egg. how can you do that? the rice is incredibly hard and chewy, with zero flavor. i had to slather on the hot sauce (which i usually don't have to - not entirely anyway) to be able to digest the grains. 

and... there were RAW lettuce in it. i know it comes with veggies, but that's just a bit weird, don't you think? 

where are you international food court and why have you been burnt down?! it's in your absence that i must deal with these over-priced scrappy asian food. in snooki's words: waaaaaah!
author: Fiona S.

description:
Very average sushi place.  The fish I find is okay.  Nothing to write home about. The service isn't so great.  In fact my boyfriend has claimed one of the waitresses is one of his arch enemies because when he ordered a beer that came to him flat, she argued with him that that was how it was supposed to taste for a few minutes.  "I order this beer all the time and this is skunked."  I tried it too and no, he wasn't trying to get a free beer, he just wanted one that tasted right.  She was nasty with us the rest of the night and the other few times we went, she held her grudge.  So we stopped going for awhile because it was just okay.

We went back last weekend and the nemesis wasn't there, but the other waitresses seemed so unhappy to be there and the fish was STILL average.  We won't be back for dinner for a long time.

It gets 3 stars instead of 2 simply because they have mind blowing lunch specials...SUPER cheap deals...and cheap food gets you far in my book.
author: Julie C.

description:
This place was pretty cheap but the quality of the food was sub-par.
I have had MUCH fresher sushi at places with the same pricepoint.

my boyfriend ordered the fried tofu steak with veggies and it was by none the WORST meal he has ever ordered in a restaurant. The "fried" skin was so soft that it was gooey and you could pick up the peice of super soft tofu with just the "fried" skin and it would stretch and ooze!

wont be coming back here
author: Keila E.

description: This place is pretty good. It's not the best quality sushi, but the price makes it all worth while. They are reasonably priced, and in fact my sushi dinner never exceeds $15. And if you have an appetite like me, you would understand that this is very hard to do! I love their salad dressing. And most especially love that they let you apply the dressing to your liking. As well as keep the entire bottle at your table! YUM! I don't normally order anything but sushi, seaweed salad and a regular green salad. My friends have had the tempura and bento boxes and didn't have any complaints.
author: Natasha S.

description:
Just OK.  To be honest, this joint holds a special place in the ole kicker - the GF used to live above it and we frequented the place together.

BUT, it is just an S.F. sushi joint - sub-standard sashimi (dyed all to hell - seriously, you DON'T want to know that color the maguro REALLY is...), worse sushi, and very good rolls.  And really the rolls are this place's strong point.  Better than any of the Van Ness joints, but not as good as Kamekyo's.  Again, par for the course.

None of the rest of the fare was anything to write home about - I'm admittedly a snob when it comes to Japanese food, and this isn't Japanese-Japanese food.  But really, for the price, in this part of town, the place is hard to beat if you're in the mood.

But if you're willing to spend some money and get genuinely world-class sushi, there's only one place to go (and I feel dirty for saying this EVERY time I say it): Ozumo...(ambiance-iCK!)
author: Forrest C.

description: Come to Miyabi on Church st if you want excellent sushis, I think the owners are Korean though! anyway, it's all good.
author: Will P.

description:
love this place at night. I went the night before valentine's day. They had cute window decorations :) We had rock n roll sushi, godzilla, salmon bento, and some other stuff. Sushi was average, but I liked being here. It's totally worth the price......everything is so darn cheap. I'd come here again beause I love church st. at night. So beautiful..

great place to go with your bf/gf
author: Bonita C.

description:
I just LOVE this place. And don't get me wrong, it's not like I'm saying this is the best sushi I've ever had in my entire life, it's just that as an establishment, this doesn't get much better in terms of combination of GREATS in my book.

GREAT sushi. This is very important. It's totally solid in my book, and I'm a sushi-lover. But what makes it stand out is that it is VERY affordable...makes it taste THAT much better. :)

GREAT service....I can't remember the waitress' name that I usually see when I go there, but she is so super friendly, and courteous, and because I'm a regular and in the neighborhood (I go so often that I think she has figured this out by now), she totally hooks me up when I get take out, or when I'm dining in. A business that isn't afraid to do that for its regulars is a real PLUS in my book.

GREAT hours...what sushi place out there is open and serving people until 12:30am? Miyabi!!! Has saved me on MULTIPLE occasions, and the atmosphere is super chill...

GREAT for groups...took ten people there one day and they didn't even blink, seated us right away...which, now that I think about it, they ALWAYS seat me right away, almost never have to wait....MAJOR BONUS POINTS...

GREAT location....now this makes me a bit biased, because it's around the corner from me, but it's also around the corner from the Church Street MUNI stop....definitely easy access...

What else can I say about this place? Amazing combo! And I can speak with authority because I've been going there for two years now, definitely a regular (sometimes go once a week for months on end), and I can't believe it took me this long to review them....So there! Go !!!
You won't be disappointed!!
author: Martina C.

description:
My sister and I have lovingly dubbed Miyabi as "our place" and for good reason.  The sushi is consistantly good and cheap.  The atmosphere is relaxed and unpretentious.  I bring a lot of friends here and am hard pressed to find anyone who doesn't like this place.

My sister and I have started ordering the sushi to-go, to allow for more lingering over conversation and wine.  Though, I have never been rushed while eating-in and the staff is usually very attentive.  Anyhow, we never wait more than 10 minutes for our to-go orders.  A nice touch- they bring hot tea to sip while we wait for our food at the table near the hostess stand. 

This is a simple place not meant for Sushi-snobs. If you want to try something a little less traditional I suggest the deep-fried asparagus and mango roll!  If you want an elevated expensive experience go to Blowfish.    

Nice people.  Good food.  Good prices.  Great for a casual meal with friends or siblings.
author: Maura M.

description:
This is a great place to come for lunch while you work!  For $5.95, you can get chicken teriyaki, california roll, rice, salad and miso soup, all of which are sizable portions.  Is the taste spectacular?  No.  But does it taste good?  Yes.  And where else can you get a sit-down Japanese lunch in the city for about $8 (tax + tip)?

The restaurant is located right next to the Church Street MUNI station.
author: Pat S.

description: There are quite a few reviews for Miyabi, and the bottom line is, for me...once is enough.  If you like sub par Japanese food at prices that are not that inexpensive then by all means enjoy. Life is too short...even if you are a cat with 9 lives.  : )
author: Gregory C.

description: Nice friendly people working here. Place is not fancy and good look a little nicer, but the fish is fresh and the rolls are always consistently good and tasty. Get the window seat and watch everyone go by as you drink saki and have a good meal. Parking is tough in the neighborhood, but its right next to a muni station.
author: Eric K.

description:
Miyabi Sushi has been my sushi go to spot since moving to the city four years ago. The food has always been fresh and delicious since my first trip here and continues to be so. I love the new look they have now with the remodeling! The staff is also very friendly and gave me free miso soup on a take out order last week. 

Great place, great food, and great price!
author: Mindy O.

description:
Miaybe is a quaint little sushi bar with good sized rolls for fair prices. If you're trying to impress a hot date by taking them out to a 'hip' sushi scene, then this is not your place. 
But if it's a weeknight and you don't want to pay extra for "atmosphere", you won't be disappointed with the fresh, inventive and affordable sushi at Miyabe.
author: Casey C.

description:
Meh. Decent sushi for the price you pay. Helluva lot better than that sauna of a sushi place across the street... aka. No Name

And what's all this talk of house music? All I heard was Phil Collins playing on the loud speaker. Gotta give it to 96.5 - KOIT.
author: I Love Beef C.

description:
One of my favourite *reasonable* sushi places.  Open late 'til 1am Mon-Sat.  

The oshitashi (spinach & vinegar) is fabulously, appropriately sour.  The fish is fresh and very good; the staff friendly.  Whenever I go with a large group we always get extras free: sake, croquettes, salad...
author: Claudine C.

description:
I am planning a trip to San Fran and my friends and I love sushi. But it seems this restaurant isn't so accommodating to the disabled. I'm horrified to have read a review where a service animal was marginalized and the customer treated as a second class citizen. Since two of my group coming to this city are disabled, I will be sure to take my business elsewhere. 

BTW, if you live in the area and have a service animal, I would go there with the animal on principle alone.
author: jay g.

description:
Mister Sushi Snob checking in!

A friend of mine brought home some Miyabi takeout and asked if I wanted to polish off the last of his California rolls. I tentatively popped one in my mouth, experimenting to make sure it was "proper sushi snob fare."

Zmog!

Today, I made up some idiot excuse to be in the Castro today just to visit Miyabi and I loved it. I had my usual first visit meal; salad, unagi nigiri and gyoza - all of it was excellent! I didn't do soup because it was a hot day, and I was not in the mood to sweat all over MUNI.

Service is very quick. I barely got my chop sticks separated for my salad when the nigiri was deposited on my table. A few minutes later, the gyoza lined up right behind the nigiri.

Yummy.

The prices here are very reasonable, hell, they are cheap! I got my bill and had to stare at it to figure out why it was so cheap. A 10 spot got me out the door (minus a lavish tip of course)

If you too need an excuse to wander over to the Castro to sample the eats, there is a Walgreens at Market and Church. You could always move your prescriptions to the local Walgreens and use the excuse that the "pharmacist on Church is a hottie" or you could come up with some other creative reason. 

Use whatever works!
author: Storm W.

description:
When I visit my sister in the city, this is my favorite place to eat dinner in her neighborhood. I am impressed at how good the sushi is when the price is so cheap. I eat sushi frequently at a variety of places and I feel that this place is at the top of my list for ambiance, friendly wait staff, quick to be seated, and creative, aesthetic, fresh sushi rolls.  
I especially love the green tea that they serve as we wait for our food. It tastes exceptionally good to me. As for food, I have only ordered rolls here. They are plentiful, pretty to look at, and very tasty.  I usually feel satisfied after eating two rolls and a miso soup.
The restaurant is small, but well decorated and clean and has a relaxed feel to it. I get the sense that they have a lot of neighborhood regulars.
I recommend this restaurant for a casual night eating experience for one person or small groups of 2 or 3 people.
author: Tricky H.

description:
This is a good late-night and take-out sushi option. The prices are decent and the fish tastes fresh. I'm by no means a connoisseur but their salmon sushi is deeeeelish.

I don't know what it is, but every time I come here and order to-go, the waitress is a total bitch. I don't deserve this treatment. I'm nice. I tip. I'm apologetic when I ask for extra wasabi and ginger (So VERY sorry. I know how much trouble it must be to roll up that extra ball of green goo.)

Well too bad Miss Look Of Disdain! This thorn in your side isn't budging. I'll be coming back again and again. I'm here! I live near! Get used to it!
author: Chelsea T.

description: Miyabi offers reasonably priced sushi. You can easily walk out satiated for $15 and that is a good thing. Not much on ambience and a dated decor, but the price is the driver here. Easy location to get to as well. Recommend just about anything on the menu.
author: Jim H.

description:
This used to be a great value of a sushi restaurant but after two visits of mediocre service and disappointing food, I would have to reconsider my original judgement.

I am reluctant to make such a harsh comment because I have had such fond memories of this sushi bar when I lived down the street.  But that was years ago and now the service has been cold and sloppy and the sushi not so fresh.  They pre-slice the fish for crying out loud.  Anyway, I wish they would do something to bring back the old Miyabi I once new...
author: Joe O.

description:
Miyabi's is my favorite place to get a huge Bento lunch for under $8 and if I'm feeling especially worthy of a good meal, I love the Sake Nigiri and the Unagi Nigiri too. Other yummy rolls include the Dragon Roll, Double Dragon and Godzilla. 

The service is good. I took my best friend here for his Birthday and the waitress brought us out some ice cream for our cake : ) It was unexpected and I thought it was so sweet of them to do.
author: Shannon A.

description:
Certainly, this isn't the best sushi joint in the world.  But it's generally reliable, the service is good, prices are reasonable, and they're open late (we never arrive before 10:30).

Our group goes at least once a week, and they quickly learned to spot us as 'regulars' and treat us well.
author: Jeff F.

description: Nothing special.  A small neighborhood sushi joint.  A great place to drop by and get a bite to eat.  I got the godzilla, Saigon, and rainbow rolls.  I don't hate it, I don't love it.  If it's in your neighborhood, it would just be a convenient place to go to when you are having cravings.
author: Julie T.

description:
There are nicer places, but for the price it is a great deal.

I had Yakitori for appetizer, and as a group shared Saigon rolls, Narita rolls, and a 'Love Boat', which is strange because it's only designed for one person (it included a single miso and salad). Miyabi proprietor, if you're reading: any product containing the term 'Love Boat' is supposed to be for two people, ok? Anyway, the Love Boat has about 12 pcs of your standard assortment of basic sushi, and provides a nice staple around which you can order some more inventive fare.  Saigon rolls are spicy tuna with tempura batter on the outside and Narita rolls are avocado, unagi, and shrimp tempura.  I thought both were well done.  

I also had a soju cocktail.   It wasn't amazing but like everything else it was great for the cost.
author: K. B.

description:
So my roommate and I wanted to venture out in the city and discover new places since we've been living in SF for about 3 years and we only really knew the "usual" places. Taking the M line, I mentioned how Ive never gotten off the Church stop. She said she has gotten off there before and knew there were a few restaurants there. I was starving, so I agreed to stop there. 

We look around at all the different restaurants and we saw Miyabi. We were both craving sushi a few days before so we decided to try it. It was really empty when we first got there but it was probably cause it was 11am and I dont think a lot of people get sushi at 11 in the morning. We ordered a bento box with beef teriyaki, tempura, and california rolls. We also ordered a double dragon roll. We decided to share it because we knew it was gonna be humongous.

A lot of people started coming in for lunch, so we knew that this place must be good if there were people coming in.

The waitress brought us two miso soups since we were sharing which was very generous of her considering the bento box only comes with one miso soup.

Our food was brought to us shortly after. Fast service.

The food was delicious. It wasn't super spectacular like the best sushi ive had in the world but It was good and I was hungry. It totally satisfied both me and my roommate even though we shared.

The double dragon roll was delicious! especially if you love avocado! 

I definitely liked this place, way more than the usual sushi place we settle for at west portal, Suki sushi. I will probably go the this restaurant if im ever feeling sushi and in the area!
author: Ricialg P.

description:
The first time I came here, I ordered the sushi lunch and decided never to come back again. The quality of the fish, especially the albacore and maguro were pretty bad. The quality of the salmon was also mediocre. When you have 3 out of 5 nigiri in the entree at a substandard quality, it means any other dish with those fish will be of substandard quality... at least until they receive their next order. 

Fortunately, I decided to give it another chance. The next time I came back, I ordered a deluxe bento box. It comes with tempura, ca rolls, 2 pieces of nigiri (salmon and tuna), gyoza, salad, miso soup, rice, and whatever main entree you choose. I usually get chicken or salmon teriyaki. For the price (around 10 dollars before tip) it is a great deal. Nothing stands out , but nothing fails greatly either. Maybe that first time was a fluke.. but the fish that come with the bento box always seems to be fine. 

Service is good, they refill tea often enough, and the waitresses are friendly. For the price, portion size, and location (close to Market) it is a good place to satisfy your craving for basic japanese food. If you are looking for super fresh, quality sushi with an ambience to match, go elsewhere.
author: Jim Y.

description:
I've decided to delete my previous snide review in favor of something much more gracious because my tune towards Miyabi has changed dramatically in the past few months.  

Sure it's far from authentic  and hip, and may seem like it's the same old  run of the mill, boring, Americanized, Japanese food.  BUT....

It's consistently delicious, open late, and the church roll is the greatest roll on the face of the planet.  Mango + deep fried asparagus= heaven, a vegetarian's wet dream.

VIVA LA CHURCH ROLL!
author: Marie S.

description:
The not-so-ancient proverb of sushi: You get what you pay for.

That said, I left my credit card there in a drunken sake bomb stupor and they had it the next day for me. Thanks Miyabi!
author: Whit P.

description:
I am giving miyabi 5 stars for the following reasons:

Service... Flawless. Every time I go in here I am greeted warmly, seated promptly, and my order is taken and brought out to me in a very timely manner. They are all very sweet, polite and hospitable.

Price... Totally affordable for casual, quality sushi.

Location... It's extremely convenient because basically every muni rail line stops here.

Food... It's ALL about the godzilla roll. Oh... my... goodness. I have found heaven in a deep-fried sushi roll. Every time I have a few extra dollars in my wallet I like to treat my boyfriend to a few godzilla rolls and some miso soup... It's cheap, delicious, filling and the perfect amount of spicy!

This is definitely in the top 10 of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco... it's probably actually in the top 5!
author: Felicity M.

description:
so yaaay! my first yelp review! and what better place to start than miyabi's!....the service staff treats us like family, cause we go here so much. Been going for years whenever me and my friends need a sushi fix this is where we go.

the church roll is all time fav. its deleesh, and the combo is so odd who woulda thought? (mango and asparagus)There is also a california roll with fresh salmon and a sliver of lemon slice wrapped around it, i forget the name, but its soooo goood.

The fish is always fresh and never smells fishy. The salmon and hamachi is yummmmmy!

gyoza is super fresh as well and is fried to a crispy goodness...

not much more to say but  that miyabi's is definitely a hidden gem in the city, and is one of the most underrated places i know.

yummm i kinda wanna go now.
author: Jennifer J.

description:
GREAT for lunch.

A lot of decent food for the price.  

I usually go for the Bento for 8 dollars, and I can never finish it.

(You get a Miso Soup, 4-5 pieces Tempura with 2 Gyoza, 6 pieces of California Roll, A small Salad, a side of Rice, AND Chicken Teriyaki)

I probably wouldn't go for dinner though.
author: Adam C.

description:
This is the local Sushi restaurant that has been around over 20 years!

The fish is fresh and of high quality.
Its updated its floors . it is not pretentious and has a very
80's style decor, making it a place that is under-stated and
not for the fashion conscious.

The love the 49er roll. The fish Boats are a great deal and price to quality ratio cannot be beat.

Its great where the people are the central focus and not the decor.
The food is consistent and love the take out from this place.

The Tempura and Teriyaki are great.
The lunch menu is incredible during the week if you are able to get there.
author: Joe R.

description:
Not sure why this place gets so many negative reviews...the night I went, it was really good!  The fish was really fresh, they were open late (a good, more healthy alternative to greasy Sparkys, across the street), and how could you go wrong with $1 miso soup?
Only problem is when my friend and I entered at 11pm, they looked a little pissed as if they were closing and we totally disrupted that...but they were open for another hour.  Also service is a little spotty.  After the wasabi burn 5 times over, I needed a tea refill...it took forever.
author: Suzanne L.

description: I always seem to come back after trying several other sushi restaurants in the bay area.  The service is really good.  Always quick and excellent quality.  I prefer the sashimi and it is always fresh and portions are quite reasonable for the price.  Once again, the service is what makes it more appealing and for a small restaurant they do a good job.   I always have a happy tummy and my wallet is not damaged!
author: David C.

description: Been here a couple times for lunch. Definitely good lunch deal with the Bento Box. Incredible amount of food for less than $10. It comes with a salad, rice, tempura, chicken teriyaki, and california rolls. Very filling, and not bad tasting. I will definitely try this place again if i'm in the area craving Japanese food. 4 stars.
author: Jeff C.

description: I really like this place. Prices are right, especially for the locale. The salad dressing is great. The atmosphere isn't amazing, but it's totally comfortable. A nice refuge from the craziness outside. They let you hang out. The food and service are great. It's like Japanese comfort food.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I have tried a few places in the city and this is by far one of my favorites.  I recommend the swamp roll as well as the godzilla roll.  Oh ya i had some other thing, yellow snapper jaw or something I can't remember what it was but sooo tasty!

I wish I lived closer.
author: Nolan E.

description:
Above average sushi, but I don't think I would make it a point to visit this place if you weren't already in the neighborhood.  

I've been here many times now since I have a friend who lives within a block.  There are 2 other sushi joints nearby, but one is cramped with no music, and the other is a sushi boat with traditional Japanese music and a much less selective menu.

This leaves us with Miyabi.  True, the top 100 music more amusing the conducive to setting an atmosphere.  The staff can be inattentive at times, and are almost always disinterested.  But the sashimi and rolls are always very good, and the price is fair.
author: Miller H.

description: This place is pretty good. Clean and fast, sometimes in the evening they get pretty packed so i usually order to go, almost weekly. Rolls are decent. Salads are OK. Never tried their sashimi so i don't know how it is.
author: dj g.

description:
For those of us who can't afford the sushi of the SF elite, Miyabi does just fine. Good sushi, good prices, nice people, open very late, never annoyingly crowded. The church roll is, indeed, delicious.

Update: I added the final fifth star to Miyabi cause they're just so damn nice, and after recently sampling some more of SF's cheaper sushi options, Miyabi is even better in comparison! So, in sum, a fabulous deal.
author: Judge M.

description: Wow, I haven't had such terrible sushi since...well never. Even grocery store sushi in Sylvania, Ohio is better than Miyabi. Hate to be harsh but no joke, my sashimi was frozen rubber. My teeth couldn't even bare to bite through all the way - stopped mid way and never looked back. I could tell from walking in not to expect fresh off the boat sushi, so thank god I didn't go for an all sushi dinner. I went with sesame spinach starter and salmon teriyaki with a side of sashimi. While the salmon was edible, the spinach was as bad as the sashimi. Typically when a restaurant says sesame, you get the thick sweet peanut like sauce. They served theirs drenched in some thin soy vinegar sauce. It was way too vinegar-y and it was tough to choke down, even with rice. Sorry, Miyabi, no stars for you.
author: Susan L.

description:
I have never been let down at this small, yet spacious sushi joint. Then again, I have only been twice...muahahaha
The fried softshell crab w/ avocado was tasty. Just the right amount of crab and fillings...
The Asparagus/Mango roll was sweet and tart and made for a delicious match... add eel to this and I bet it would be fantastic...
The spicy (white) tuna roll (pocky roll) was tasty! Not too spicy, but enough to tickle the tongue. The amount of fish was plenty, a mouthfull without giving an overpowering taste of the sea.
Lastly, you will be able to enjoy great company (here on a trendy street) and still be able to talk and connect. Whether out on a date or just meeting friends, this spot will always fill you up and not empty your wallet!
author: Mitchell W.

description: The food is great and so is the service . . . we never have to wait long to get our food. The rolls are very good and everything is affordable.
author: Karina S.

description: We have come here a few times and there are really not many options for vegetarians.  There is the vegetable tempura which comes with soup (that has fish in it).  The tempura is OK, but if you are vegetarian, do not come here.
author: Jonathan U.

description: Miyabi is my go to Sushi place!  Eat the Godzilla Roll!  It will change your life!  They have another roll that is essentially a fried roll of cream cheese... aaamazing!
author: Hayley T.

description:
I just meet a friend here for lunch a couple of times a month. We both have the Bento for $7.95 -- so, we're out the door for under $10.

Pleasant, cheap, convenient.
author: BigJohnS F.

description: I love this place. I wondered into this place to meet a friend for lunch. They had this combo plate that had sushi, salad, soup, chicken, tumpra and more, all for the low price of 7.95. You just cant beat that deal. I had my sushi fix and for under 10$. I go back all the time, now!!
author: Heather P.

description: I make it a point to come here every time I'm in San Fransisco. Miyabi is so good! Taste's great, seems fresh, and very cheap! You can get two regular rolls and a drink for less than 10 bucks! I've probably been here about four or five times. Service is fast and somewhat friendly. I'm not a fan of their bathroom, its old and ghetto.
author: Jason L.

description: I think Myabi is one of the best sushi places in town. Prices are reasonable, service is consistently good.
author: Margaret R.

description:
After being threatened with having coins thrown at me by a homeless man in the Tenderloin for not shelling out a dollar, my boyfriend and I in our shocked state decided to seek comfort through sushi and nice bowl of miso soup. 

We got our miso soup and also a complementary edamame. I had ordered the Shogun dinner special. Before I even had time to squeeze an edamame pod in my mouth, my bento box dinner arrives. The waitress struggled to create room on the table given that she just filled it with our drinks, soup, and salad just a few seconds ago. My precious appetizer time had been stolen from us. 

The restaurant must get their fresh load of fish on Mondays; we went on a Sunday. The tuna was brownish and the salmon slimy. The salmon teriyaki was lean cuisine bland as well. 

I give this place two stars because I did enjoy the yellow pickles. The price wasn't so bad either but I could pay the same amount on 9th Ave for better sushi and appetizer indulgence time.
author: Wing P.

description: After hearing of Miyabi from several friends and reading mixed reviews here, I decided it was time to try it out. The verdict? The sushi is good but not spectacular, but the service was very friendly and I liked the atmosphere. The fish and shellfish is nice and fresh, but the rice is not as good as I've had elsewhere... and that makes a difference for sushi. I definitely prefer Daimaru on 17th and Sanchez which is a bit slow but worth the wait for totally awesome sushi and sashimi!
author: José C.

description:
So cheap!  So fresh!  Such big portions!  Such nice people!

I am bored of No-Name's lack of salmon and lack of tempura.  I am extra bored of waiting in line for over an hour to be crowded wtih strangers and hurried out.  Go across the street to Miyabi, it ain't that much more, really.
author: Frankie D.

description: The food is fresh but the service can be unfriendly and indifferent. The Deluxe Bento is good and offers good portions.
author: Dean J.

description: The sushi isn't great but it's trustworthy. I like going here when I want tempura or teriyaki with my rolls.
author: m t.

description: Hands down good spot for lunch.  $7 will get u a bento box lunch which includes salad, miso soup, cali rolls and a choice of meat.  Cant go wrong with that.
author: Mimi S.

description:
TO BE CLEAR, the restaurant across the street from No-Name (which is fun the first time or two, but the steamy windows and often times warm sushi is off putting) is actually called Warakubune - a "sushi boat" type place which is entertaining and fast if you need a quick fix, but if you know what you want it's kind of a waste of time - hard to order from the chefs who are pre-occupied with keeping the boats stocked.

Miyabi - ok, it's not a Tokyo Go-Go, Zushi Puzzle, or Ebisu.  But if you regulary eat sushi, and live in the castro/noe/mission area, this is your place.  Normal rolls are between $3-4, specialty rolls are $7-11, and nigiri is $2.50-5.  Always fresh, good specials board, EXCELLENT service.
author: Steve H.

description: I used to be a regular at this place until yesterday.  The restaurant was at most half full.  My two friends and I wanted to have a few rolls, nothing too heavy, so we ordered 3 rolls, and a couple of drinks.  The waitress came back and told us that we hadn't reached the 6 dollar per person minimum.  While we were annoyed by this we decided to order a seaweed salad to share.  The waitress brought the salad plus edamame and when we informed her we only wanted the seaweed salad she spoke to the manager and then told us that we should leave.  After speaking to the manager his response was "your generation likes to hold tables".  Never going back again.
author: Gabriel B.

description: The best lunch prices in town for a Japanese combo plate.  The food is always good. They stay open until 3 pm for lunch, which is nice for us that eat late.
author: Len M.

description: I would have given this place 3 to 3.5 stars if it weren't for the service. This place is good but the service is sooooo slow if not non-existent. I've been there twice and really like their rolls, but after being practically ignored when there were only 2 other tables (one of which the guy had to get up just to pick up his food at the sushi bar) I don't think I will be going there again.
author: Crystal P.

description: This place is super cheap for some decent sushi. The staff is nice and atmosphere is very casual. The best part is that they are open late!!! They close at midnight on weekends!
author: Lipa M.

description: Tasty sushi rolls but pass on the Nigiri which requires quality cuts of fish.
author: Andy L.

description:
food here is cheap.  fills my gut just fine at a decent price, but definitely not high quality japanese food, nor can i say its close to authentic.  very americanized, with their various roll concoctions.  while eating, i get the feel that the fish could be colder, not room temp...

the godzilla roll - unagi and spicy tuna.  great, but very mashy inside, i couldnt tell wats in there if not for the menu...

the funky dooty roll - asparagus, mango, and spicy tuna.  best bite of the nite, although again, the tuna is kinda off, roomy temp...

meh.
author: Ethan L.

description:
I have a love-hate relationship with Miyabi. All the vegetarian sushi is GREAT, however, the miso soup contains fish sauce, and depending on the day/server you will either be clued in on this, or not when asked. Being vegetarian I always ask these questions to protect myself from any accidental meat-ingestion (yes fish is meat, its not a vegetable)
On my first visit there I was told there was no fish sauce in it, so a few times I ordered the soup. Another time a waiter told me it did have fish sauce in it (I asked again because it tasted funny) and then another time I asked again and was told it indeed did not have fish sauce...so I ordered it again. how stupid of me! The next time I went and ordered it, they waiter told me it *just had a little* fish sauce in it, and didnt seem to understand that *just a little* is not the same as *none at all*. It seems alot of asian restaurants are like this..they seem to not have an understanding that vegetarian generally means you also dont want to have your food cooked WITH animal products, even if its not an added or large ingredient! Come to think of it, its not just an asian restaurant thing, but thats where Ive had the most problems. Anyways...if youre veggie the rolls are great but stay away from the miso!
author: John G.

description: I would definitely say the food TASTES good... however, I have NEVER before gotten sick from sushi, and I got horrible food poisoning from eating here. I only recommend it to those who love to be ill.
author: Brian R.

description: I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning on my first visit.  I haven't been back since, and I'm too afraid to return.
author: Andrea U.

description: This place is pretty good considering it's price ( not too expensive compare to many ) I like the how the restaurant close at 12AM which allows me to have Japanese food late at night.  Their rolls are exceptionally good and their sashimi. Unfortunately their plate such as the bento box aren't so great. Sometimes it's too dry, no taste, too salty, etc and the good/bad part is that they give you too much. I also notice that their vegetables are fresh (in their rolls)  I hate it when avocado gets too hard, luckily theirs are soft. Hmm what else... I like their customer service, their chef is funny as hell and their staff are friendly.
author: Will C.

description: I've been to this restaurant a view times.  I guess I am a patience person.  This place have a bad service.  The waiter/waitress are slow like a turtle and probably senile too, although they are young, i gues they are just ignorant.  By the way, if you come in afternoon or after 9pm bring a newspaper or magazine, because if you order sushi only it'll take at least 1/2 hour to make 'em.  Some of the sushi are not fresh, spicy tuna rolls ........yuckkss....I almost thought it's nasty tuna rolls.  Anyways, my point it this place was good, but now is very disappointing.
author: Albert W.

description:
I've been to Miyabi a few times for both dinner and lunch and have always been satisfied- the prices are reasonable and a place i will return to.  The sushi, sashimi, fancy rolls are fresh and creative. The menu pretty much covers the standard salads, seaweed, apps, edamame, miso soup (i) rice dishes- curry, katsu, pork cutlets, chicken/beef/salmon terriyaki; (ii) the soup-based noodles- udon, ramen and the bento box lunch specials. I was pleased to learn that they do serve more authentic items such as beef tataki and hamachi kama but more exotic soups like dobun mushi or anything other than miso were not available. So in other words- if you're eating sushi you can expect the tuna (chu-toro, oh-toro), salmon, yellow-tail to be good but not phenomenal and perhaps don't be disappointed if you can't order the more exotic items like; sea urchin, fish liver, live scallop, lobster.
Service is great and very polite/ friendly.
Decor is simple with the obligatory bartop hello-kitty gizmo on display.
author: Akash D.

description: Open late, that is the plus. For the price, you can get much better elsewhere. I was here one late night and was basically rushed out but the turning off of lights and clearing of our table, even though I was still with food midway to my mouth!  Sheesh... they should have just turned us away if they weren't going to be patient with us.
author: Amelia M.

description: I really do love this place everything I have had from here has always been really fresh and really tasty I even love the salad dressing they use for the house salad...mmmmm.  I would totally give them five stars but the last time I went there the waitress totally sucked! She acted really weird when I came in with my 2 year old and best friend and took a really time even saying aything to us at all.  When she finally did say something she pointed us to our table all the way in the back and told us to sit there.  After we sat down we waited for about 10 minutes for a menu.....never happened.  I just got up and grabbed us our menus.  She finally came over seeing that we were ready and took our order.  Our food came out in good time but she never gave my friend a spoon for the soup or even brought us napkins or chopsticks I had to steal them from another table. Luckily for us the food was at least delicious.  Im not sure what her problem was but oh well it wont deter me from coming back and enjoying their delicious food again!
author: Patricia P.

description: We waited 45 minutes for our food.  People who came in 40 minutes after us got their food around the same time we did.  LAME.  My miso soup turned cold and so did my heart as I kept looking at the one waitress serving everyone else but us.  She wasn't intentionally ignoring us; it was oblivion, the state of being clueless.  She apologized but I really didn't have anything to say.  I'm giving two stars because I've been here before and have enjoyed their affordable and decent lunch specials.  I like their salmon terriyaki.
author: Mijin L.

description: The sushi was good. Not great but good.  But I was stuffed. My friend was stuffed.  We paid less than $40.  We had nigiri and rolls and beer.  That's absolutely awesome. The waitress was also attentive.
author: Heidi P.

description: The bf and I happened to be walking by on a Sunday evening and decided to stop in for dinner.  Like most others have said, it's a good place for sushi, but not excellent.  Service was a little weird (the hostess/waitress didn't speak a word, and the waiter left a lot of stuff uncleared on our table) but at least they were fast bringing us our food and the check.  The unakyu and mushroom rolls weren't as tightly wrapped as I'm used to but they packed a lot of fish/veggies into them, and they were only $3.50 each, if I remember correctly.  The bf got the udon and liked it well enough.  Salads were a little watery and they give you the dressing to put on yourself, which would be fine, except it's a little disgusting staring at a huge, unattractive bottle of mayo dressing while you eat.
author: Gina K.

description:
My friend and I were out  and about strolling through Castro, and we couldn't decide where we wanted to go for dinner. We had tried a couple sushi places in the area, but we were really wanting something new.  We stumbled upon Miyabi and figured we'd give it a try. There wasn't a wait, which can either be a good or a bad thing, for this occasion it was a good thing, a very good thing. First of all, the fish was fresh, the rice  was fresh-as rice should be when one makes sushi yet so many  sushi chefs seem to disagree with me on this. On my first trip I tried the tai, ika and the kappa maki,and  all of my selections were excellent. I also tried a kiwi soju cocktail, I was impressed by this as well. There were actual bits of kiwi right in the cocktail, it was pretty amazing. When the check came I was impressed, yet again. The prices were insanely low, I actually thought it was a mistake. However, I got over it and accepted the low fee. 
I have returned to Miyabi on several occasions and I have yet to be disappointed by the service, the food, the drinks or my tab! Well done Miyabi!
author: Natalie M.

description:
just discovered this spot the other night as my friends were grudgingly trying to accept burgers for dinner and the painful realization that our normal sushi spots were all closed. 

as we were about to turn in for the burger spot; we realized that we saw the magical words, "open" and "sushi." Eureka, they're open and we still have a good amount of time left to chow down (closing was 12am)..

order the amazing unagi... i think that ends this review..  ^_^
author: Anita J.

description: Be prepared to drink loads of water from them cooking with way too much soysauce. e.g. tofu steak.
author: Sunny C.

description: consistently good sushi, decent price, convenient location, good service....there is a back room available for larger groups...the reason I only give 3 stars is because there was a miscommunication when I reserved the backroom, and they neglected to tell me that each of my friends had to order at least $20 of food to be seated there.  Other than that, I have had pretty good experiences.
author: regina k.

description: this place is my definate cheap destination to get good quality sushi at awesomely cheap prices. I usually can order about 6 or 7 rolls between 2 people and have saki and miso soup and edamame for under 35 dollars for both people. The staff is super friendly, it's in a really convenient location, they do some pretty fancy rolls like a dragon and catepillar. pretty much this place is the cheapest and easiest to get to sushi in the city IMHO. check it out and make sure to get stuffed for cheap!
author: Sean B.

description: This place has kinda taken a dive in the last few years- it's not as clean or as fresh and I've altogether stopped eating here.  I know that several other Miyabi's have opened up in other parts of the the city recently; perhaps they are just stretched too thin and will eventually rebound.
author: saru k.

description: This is my go to place when I don't to spend a ton of money at Barracuda. My bf and I always order the bento box, sashimi, and a couple different rolls. The food is always good, the people are always nice, and it is always consistent. Just went for lunch the other day and they had some great prices and it was quite nice drinking miso soup while watching the rain come down. Although, the quality of their tuna is questionable every once in a while but besides that very delicious.
author: Tiffany D.

description: I actually haven't been to Miyabi in years. I went here with a friend last night because it's really close to our gym, and you know working out after work during rush hour at the gym left us starving. So, we quickly made our way to Miyabi before the urge to scarf down cheeseburgers won us over. I had the Chicken teriyaki and sashimi dinner.
