It was slightly heavy with teriyaki sauce but all of my sashimi (like nine pieces - no kidding) were fresh and decent in size. For $11.99 with soup, salad and tea, I think this is a pretty good deal, and the service was prompt and friendly.
author: J F.

description: This is an ordinary sushi restaurant. Not bad, but not great. My biggest complaint was that there were fish scales in my Hamache nigiri .
author: Robert C.

description:
worst service ever. 

i understand that at most sushi places the tables are small and the service generally doesn't ooze warmth. but this was a little too much. when we arrived we were literally seated at someone else's table--the waiter physically moved a woman's purse so i could sit down and then slid the table an inch to separate our table from the women already eating. 

after being seated, we sat there for 10 minutes until flagging down a waiter before he rushed away after giving someone else their bill. while my friend was ordering, the waiter abruptly cut him off for a second and walked away and at the end of the meal we again had to flag someone down to get the final bill. 

besides the poor services, the restaurant is quite small. you either have to choose a seat by the door, which is drafty, or the kitchen, which puts you in danger of being hit by a waiter. 

the food is actually pretty good. i really enjoyed my tuna poke--the fish was cut in thick chunks, and was arranged really artistically on a bed of lettuce and was topped with seaweed salad. so props to the sushi chef. also, the happy hour menu from 4:30-6:30 has a nice selection of small sushi rolls that are really cheaply priced. 

however, the bottom line is--there are about 12 other sushi restaurants in the same area. the food is good, but not enough to make up for everything else. you don't need to eat there, so go somewhere else.
author: Mary Beth D.

description: I order from Miyabi once a week on average.  Chicken teryiaki and of course... a godzilla roll.  Heaping portions and an extremely friendly staff who treat their regulars well, this late night spot gets 5 from me.
author: Clay K.

description: The food is great for the price, there Bento boxes are a nice combo of sushi, teriyaki, and tempura.  The staff is super friendly and very accommodating.  The place is easily accessible from the Church street Muni station.
author: Colin F.

description: I've only had takeout for Miyabi. I stick with rolls because I'm a little skeptical about the freshness of their fish for sashimi or nigiri. The prices are reasonable compared to Crazy Sushi, and they're open late. Takeout orders are usually done in 10 minutes and it is in a super convenient place. Probably wouldn't bother with eating in because I live just down the street.
author: Lisa P.

description:
The sushi is not outstanding cum in  your pants good, and the service is mixed; good one night, average the next. However there are a few things worth trying. The seafood tempura combo is more than worth the price. Usually when ordering said dish at other places, you get the standard 2 pieces of shrimp, and filler vegetable tempura. Not the case here, you actually get more than just shrimp, you get scallops, and crab tempura, and a mix of vegetables, I think even squid. It is quite filling. If I'm in the mood for sushi I get the dynamite roll, a combo of white tuna, and regular tuna, which I don't think is on the menu but it's up on their specials board. The asparagus and sour mango roll is also good.
The sashimi however is not the best I've had, so I probably wouldn't order that again.  Some of their soju cocktails are just okay, I would say go for the plum wine instead.  An added bonus; its one of the few places  serving sushi at 1 in the morning, and you get seated right away. Go here if you're in the neighborhood and it's late, but it's not special enough to make the trek to check it out.
author: X marks the spot ..

description: I love this place. It's reliable and affordable, though not much in the way of atmosphere. I would recommend this spot for weekday dinner and/or lunch. I come for lunch frequently and get 2 rolls and a green salad. Guess what folks? That comes to a grand total of $7! That's right. Now, the rolls I'm talking about are not on the specialty roll menu. These are plain ol' spicy tuna, salmon, avocado...etc. The service is attentive and the green tea is free. Works for me.
author: Liz R.

description: I went to this restaurant with my family on Christmas eve. We were so disappointed in the service. The waitress was rude and the food took very long time, we waited like about 30 Min's and the food didn't even come yet. The restaurant wasn't even busy. it was already 10pm at that time.
author: sherry w.

description: Not super great food, but clean, friendly, and a good value. Perfect for lunch, not so impressive for most anything else.
author: Jonny A.

description: Score!  A local sushi place that's open late!  Great to know if I ever crave some sushi around midnight I have a place to fulfill my cravings.
author: Debbie Y.

description:
Update 1/22/08:
ive been here a few times since, and it was much better. cheap, tasty, nothing spectacularly special but always good. i never got sick again so it was just a one off and probably nothing to do with eating. the water is a little slow but the rest of the service is fine. yes so tasty and i'll probably keep going back.


Original:
I went here on a sunday evening for dinner. We were seated right away; there were other people but not full.  I don't like that you have to pick the rolls and sushi all from a little piece of paper. the main rolls and things aren't even on the menu. so there were four of us peering at one slip of paper trying to mark things down. n ended up getting the fishie ones, and j, b and i shared 5 sets of rolls.  we had 2 of the fancy ones, which i think were all $7-9 or so, and 3 of the non fancy ones, which were only $4. so it was very cheap. besides the paper, the other bad thing about this place was that it was very slow. sooo slow. we ordered, and it took i dont even know how long. by then there were only a couple other people. it took FOREVER. then it took another forever after we were done to get our check, we had to ask for it. j and b were almost late for an appt! the sushi itself was pretty good, i liked it. the only thing is, when i got home, i felt pretty ill. feverish or something and i dont know, something disagreed with me, i felt like something had peanut oil or something. but j and b ate the same thing as me and they were fine and they wouldnt be if there had been peanuts theyd be dead. so who knows. i'd probably still go back at least once.
author: Merredith L.

description: Yeah, I dunno. They had a couple of good rolls, but the services was less than stellar. Food quality was fine, not anything special, but the experience amounted to a mediocre sushi place that would have been enjoyable if our server hadn't been so over-worked and dismissive. Maybe it was just the busy Saturday night rush.
author: Tom H.

description: Standard sushi fare. Sashimi is the way to go here as their sushi rice tastes like it is old or undercooked.
author: matt m.

description: This is my secondary source for great sushi ( first is chi, take a look at review). The service is pretty terrible, we sat for over 25 minutes to have our order taken, and the resturant was totally empty.. we had to ask for chop sticks, blah blah so they were having a bad day-eh?! As far as selection, not the absolute best, but it got the job done, and I recommend the gyozas for sure!
author: Liz C.

description: Oh man i would drive to San Fran everynight if I could. I tried it for the first time with a friend who raves about it all the time and I am so hooked. I dont think anything you order could be bad but my absolute loved the soft shell crab fried and the UNI is great. All of it was DELICIOSO!!!!!!
author: Brenda S.

description: Why go here when you can go down the block to Warakabune? Ah, because it's open late. It was so-so but I only ordered one or two nigiri and an avocado roll. I think this place is all about "being seen" in the window spot.
author: Anna B.

description:
my boyfriend and i go here all the time for many reasons:
1. it's open really late
2. it's pretty cheap
3. it's yummy 
4. it has consistently good quality
5. the church roll is amazing
6. it's walking distance from his place
7. it's never too busy (i don't think we've ever had to wait)
8. their salad dressing is soo good
it's not the best sushi in sf by any means, but for the price, hours, tastiness and consistency, it's one of my faves
author: lisa w.

description: poor miyabi gets a bit of a beating.  I'm not a big fan of their sushi, but the beef udon is the BEST.  Cute little spot in my hood, makes me feel at home walking past it.
author: rhiannon B.

description: i've been going to this place for about 12 years  through different owners the food has remained consistently good. i always get the bento box and it's ALOT of food, enough to feed an adult (me) my  4 year old son AND my 5 year old niece. i had the chicken teriyaki, shrimp tempura,salad, miso soup,six piece california roll and a bowl of rice for $7.95. the price in 3 months has gone up ONE DOLLAR  to $8.95 still a bargain. this is a nice  place nothing fancy schmancy but good food to share with some good friends or family
author: Jo K.

description: The Sushi is okay but I like their lunch Bento box, it comes with a miso soup and a salad. Reasonable price!
author: Lavinia W.

description:
Love it. 
Incredible value. DELICIOUS seaweed salad. Cheap cheap cheap but never disappoints. Smiley staff and fun music.
author: Annie L.

description: Patrons beware, this place doesn't even deserve the one star! I've never written a yelp review before due to indolence, but this place is so terrible that it prompted me to warn others. If you don't mind painful stomachaches and nasty diarrhea for a couple days from food poisoning, then be my guest and try this place. If you are still going to be brave, then bring your Pepto-Bismol. My sister and I both got sick, and it probably was the gyoza or the tofu.  Stay away!
author: Tyffani N.

description: I've had two wonderful experiences here. The first a dine in experience with wonderful service and great special rolls. Last night really sold me on this place tho. I walked in after droppin 30 dollars at Nihon and leaving with an even worse sushi craving than I started with. At Miyabi, we ordered 5 rolls off their basic makimono list and a seaweed salad to go. This came to about $22. We were greated with smiling faces, every employee that walked by had greeted us. They offered us hot tea and edamame while we waited. Sunny had served us with our to go order and was an absolute sweetheart. They even gave us complimentrary miso soup to go! This place is swanky or hip, and you won't chat it up with some cute guy at the bar over a well crafted $15 dollar cocktail. But will always be treated warmly and get that sushi comfort fill that I know I get every now and then. Gotta love the consistency :) Will DEFINITELY be back!
author: Brandi B.

description: By far. the BEST Chirashi in San Francisco!  A generous variety of fresh sashimis and other treats makes this a winner!
author: Robb S.

description: I like it here. Good vegetarian selection, good prices. laid back. yeah.
author: Erin S.

description: A friend had a bday party here a couple weeks ago.  The location was chosen for it's affordability.  So, that being said, I think the best thing about it is that the sushi is decent and affordable.  I don't think they have the waitstaff to accommodate big groups, but they also seemed to be aware of this fact because they comp'ed us appetizers and sake.  The food isn't fantastic by any means, but I think it's pretty good.
author: Martine D.

description: What a great place for a healthy quick and cheap lunch. If I'm craving japanese and its before 230pm I order the deluxe Bento box and I must say its heavenly. California roll salmon teriyaki rice miso soup 3 pieces of nigiri and tempura all for about 10 bucks. Also the dragan and spider roll are extremely overrated. Staff is friendly and restaurant is very clean.
author: Lauren M.

description: I go here at least once a week for lunch and I usually get the Deluxe Bento Box which is a lot of food for the $$. Sushi taste good but its not the best I've had. Their gyoza is the bomb and the miso soup taste great. I really like the variety that they offer on their lunch menu. Service is great  and the wait staff is really nice. Cute and cozy place too and doesn't get too noisy like other places.
author: Christian C.

description: I love this place.  Its the only sushi place I know with a fried asparagus&mango roll.  Its got great prices and bottomless green tea and the staff is awesome.
author: Ona E.

description: I love coming to this place!! I don't think its overpriced at all, love coming here and ordering my cali roll, and the service is always good they're really nice!!
author: Odracir M.

description: My dear friends took me to their favorite restaurant one Saturday evening. We were seated and the server took our drink order. What was cool after we received our menus there was sushi order card. On this card you check off the number of rolls you want to order. I'm assuming the card is used to cut down on confusion on what the customer order. We order seven rolls and an appetizer. The chicken yakatori was good, you can't go wrong with that dish, unless it comes out burned. The rolls were excellent. We pretty much ate all the rolls with a few pieces left.  The restaurant decor was really nice, but the bathroom could use some updating. I would definitely go again for more sushi and spend a $90 with no problem.
author: Baseemah R.

description: Good sushi. I go here because I can get seated right away no matter the day or time. They like to give you extra goodies, like ice cream at end of meal. Always have funny top 100 music playing but sushi good and fresh and great selection. Plus fun soju drinks.
author: Alyssa C.

description: I actually think it has pretty decent sushi and rolls some of the time, then really really delicious fish everytime I go there. I haven't eaten there in ages though and do miss it. The servers are friendly and the chefs always say hi and bye to you! I'm probably biased because I live close by but I used to go to Miyabi all the time and never have eaten anything that tasted bad or unfresh here!
author: Gina R.

description: everyone jocks no name, and dont get me wrong no name is cheap as hell and pretty darn good. But miyabi can bring it. Fresh sushi . Very very very nice staff who especially if you are from the neighborhood as I am get to really know you by name and make you feel at home. if you are getting takeout they will sit you down w some tea while you wait. I like what they are pushing
author: Lauren V.

description: Now that I know what goes on in that kitchen I am never eating at a Miyabi restaurant in this city again and I encourage others to do the same! I have a friend who used to work in the kitchen here and told me how they take advantage of their workers. They only pay them $5.50 an hour (way below minimum wage) and don't pay for overtime. The owner also once threatened to call immigration and have a worker deported for complaining about the pay. I bet the reason why this food is so cheap is because they underpay and overwork their staff.
author: Pepita T.

description: I've never heard of Miyabi Japanese Restaurant, but Noname sushi at 253 Church is my single favorite restaurant in the city. You can't beat the ambiance. Do you know how much it would cost to fake the decor in a place like this? Just think of how much the set for Bladerunner must have cost. I swear to god I saw someone walk by the window with a fluorescent light-tube on their umbrella the other day. And stop whining about the quesitonable cleanliness, just eat it man you'll be fine it's not like handling raw fish is rocket science, I'm sure those greasy dudes in the back wash their hands as much as the next guy.  And my favorite thing about my favorite restaurant? We had Rick James as a server once, actual real Rick James, only he was disguised as a Japanese woman.  We saw through it though, DIDN'T WE RICK!
author: Geronimo G.

description: I found this restaurant pretty inexpensive for Japanese food. Quality of food is good as well. Not a fancy atmosphere, maybe you wanna go with friends, not with your dates.  Don't expect for a great service.
author: Jelly G.

description: As a Fillmore veteran, I consider the Duboce Terrace area an extension of home...and this was one of those spots that I frequented on a regular basis.  Try their Tempura, Spicy Tuna & Philadelphia Rolls...super fresh & deelish.  I wish that I still lived right around the corner...then again, the fact that I don't is probably a GOOD thing...
author: Amoura B.

description: The price of sashimi and tempura rolls earned this place one whole extra star.  I'd forgotten where cheap sushi could be had since the no-name place across the street shuttered it's windows and doors post fire.  It was busy last night, I was doing the solo dining thing, my food came all at once - overwhelming, but not unusual for a sushi spot, no?  I got a big ol' Kirin, sashimi deluxe (11 pieces)  and tempura roll. Liked the roll, loved the white tuna, and found the other sashimi to be good.  Not great. Good.  30 bucks.  Not too shabby for a feast.  I'll be back for a sushi craving fix again, it was pretty convenient.
author: Lindsay B.

description: The food was good, sashimi tasted quite fresh, I got the deluxe plate and it came with edamame, miso, and a bowl of rice,  four types of fish, and octopus, quite generous for $11. service was great, prompt and polite, I felt the ambiance was a little tacky, more on the fast-food sushi style. I'll eat here again.
author: Isaac D.

description: Good neighborhood sushi joint. Not the higher end dining experience some crave but the type of place to grab some roll on your way home from work. I lived on 15th St. for 10 years before moving away and on a recent visit Miyabi hadn't changed a bit.
author: Jim G.

description: The Church Street roll is damn good. Really really good sushi, aspecially compared to a lot of places. The music is usually like Backstreet Boys and hip hop 90s. Pretty fun.
author: Liss C.

description: I went here about a year ago and it wasn't all that great. I went back yesterday for lunch and I thought it was excellent. Prices were right and the portions were huge. My co-worker got a Bento Box w/ Chicken Teriyaki and Tempura. I got the Godzilla Roll and a side of Tempura. This was an insane amount of food between the 2 of us. The Godzilla Roll was probably the best  "special" roll I've ever had. The combination of tastes is just incredible. Tempura was cooked well and was crisp and flaky. The chicken teriyaki was bomb and whatever that salad dressing they have there is also good. Service was okay, but it doesn't take much to make me happy. I might have to go back one more time just to see if this place is consistant. I was super stoned too.
author: Call Me Z.

description:
Yummy! This is a standard tasty sushi restaurant. Nothing about it really sticks out in my mind, but I definitely enjoyed my meal.

I got the wakame seaweed salad (mmm) and the 49ers roll (California roll on the inside, with salmon and lemon on top). All very tasty, though the 49ers roll doesn't compare to Sushi House's Island roll. I tried my friends' meals too. The tuna sashimi was good, I thought, but my friend wasn't terribly impressed. He said the texture was off, even though the flavor was right. I guess I'm not much of a tuna connoisseur. The other rolls I had were: crazy roll (I got the end piece, not very much fish in it, but good), some sort of spicy tuna spring onion roll (pretty good but I don't really like spicy tuna all that much), whatever the sour plum roll is called (that was an experience!), and some sort of mystery roll that was deep fried and spicy (yum!!). My vegetarian friends got a roll with mango and deep fried asparagus that looked to die for, but I didn't try it, sadly. My boyfriend's beef sukiyaki was quite delicious as well--very flavorful & savory. I loved the rice noodles in the bottom.

Service: Only okay. It's a small restaurant and they were nice enough to push a couple of tables together to fit our party of 9--though they seemed a bit annoyed that we didn't just want to sit at 2 tables. The food came within a reasonable amount of time, but they were bad about filling up our water glasses--to the point where we were having to share waters because some people ran out and needed water immediately. When my water first came, it smelled icky, like moldy towels, but when I told the waitress, she was VERY prompt about replacing it, and very sweet and apologetic. So that was nice.

Final analysis: I'd go back! But I wouldn't necessarily go out of my way to go there. Though I do want to try that mango asparagus roll...

On a sushi scale of 1-10, I'd say Miyabi gets about a 6.5 or 7.
author: Heather H.

description: good food and service for the price, mediocre ambience.
author: Wendelin R.

description: Open late (well, later than the rest of SF), unique & fun rolls, quick seating, cheap saki, friendly staff...love this place. Added an extra star for the random encounters of acquaintences of sorts.
author: jen w.

description: I love Miyabi with all of my heart!  I rarely go more than 2 weeks or so without indulging myself in it.  Every single roll I have ever gotten here has been amazingly amazing (try the Narita roll...or the Oshinko...or Jumping California...or Tobiko...or Inari...all of them, actually) and the service is excellent.  I'm quite the regular so I tend to get a free bowl of edamame or miso.  The Udon is also quite tasty although I like my soup very flavorful and theirs is very tame so I usually have add some spicy ground chili-peppery-stuff.  A+++!
author: Suzanne K.

description: Great Sushi  ... but even better simple everyday Meals (to go!).  Pork Cutlet (Tonkatsu) try it with house dressing or the plum sauce.  Chicken or Salmon Teriyaki (grilled), Tempura (battered and fried)  and my Heart-Healthy Favorite Saba Shuyaki (grilled mackerel).  Hey! try it First ... and you'll never go back to Salmon!
author: Jerz Z.

description:
loooooooooved it.  sushi counter was very clean and elegant, yet comfortable.  booth seats looked really nice as well.
sushi course was as good as it gets.  all dishes are made with care, and fish were so fresh and right temperature.  truly one of the best in the country, and i'd go there everyday, if i can!
author: SANG WON J.

description: I used to love this place, but there is a reason you can always get a seat here now... Back in the day (dot-com come back!), quality was top-notch here.  At 1am on a Friday night you could get a crispy spider roll fried in clean oil and a spicy tuna hand-roll with a wrapper that snapped in against your teeth, but lately it's been rubbery seaweed wrappers, dry-ish rice and stale fish. Hmmm... the economy is hurting us all.  Proceed with caution.
author: E L.

description: Started off the meal with some miso soup and edamame. This place is so authentic they don't even give you a soup spoon and you drink it straight from the cup. Both were good. Then we had a California roll, a roll with fried salmon, a roll with fried crab, and some roll with unagi in it. All were good except I wasn't crazy about the unagi since it had some sort of BBQ sauce in it. The crab legs were sticking out of one of the pieces, making it difficult for me to eat...even with my hands, because I fail when it comes to chopstick usage. Overall I'd definitely go here again.
author: Matt H.

description: Overall a good average sushi spot.  What makes it stand out for me is the Asparagus and Mango roll.  Gets the extra star to bring it to a four.
author: Jayson J.

description: Miyabi's sushi makes me wanna barf! I've seen better sushi than their's. A friend  recommended it for me and i regret listening to him!
author: edwin q.

description: I like Miyabi.  Prices are extremely reasonable, the waitresses are all super friendly and the sushi is straight forward and usually extremely fresh.
author: Erik R.

description: I would have loved to love Miyabi, but I just cant!  Dinner was really disappointing - their sushi was not fresh and even the ginger seemed old and dried out.  Even worse, our tummies didn't feel so hot afterwards.  I think I'll walk a block down to Warakabune next time.
author: Jon B.

description: This is another lunch place during work days. I've taken many people here and they all like it. It's inexpensive as japanese restaurants go, and the food is good. Not spectacular and won't knock your socks off, but will fill you up enough to go back to work. I usually go for the bento box as that's the best deal in the house. I do notice that if you go when they first open at 11:30am, they'll fill your bento box with the previous night's chicken teriyaki. It comes out kinda tough as if it was recooked. So go around 11:50am if you can wait. The sushi is ok as i sometimes go for the tekka maki. So if you're on furlough or your credit card is maxed, then this place is for you as you'll still have a dollar or two left when you leave. Service is better when the newer waitresses are there. the older veterans tend to make you wait for your tea, as if they'll get to you when they feel like it. i wouldn't recommend this place for large groups. Probably good for groups no larger than 4.
author: Hagow C.

description: The restaurant was fairly busy when we ate there, and after our experience, I have no idea why or how.  I ordered a dinner combo - tekka maki with 6 pieces of chef's choice ngiri plus salad and miso soup.  The miso soup was not good.  The salad was even worse.  Wilty, questionable looking lettuce drowned in dressing.  The tekka maki was ok, but the ngiri was definitely not fresh.  The worst were the tamago and ebi ngiri.  The tamago was a dull yellow color and extremely rubbery.  I didn't even know egg could have that texture or (nasty) flavor!  And the shrimp looked like it had been sitting on the counter for several days... and then dropped on the floor.  Blech.  It is a little cheaper than the average sushi joint, but Sushi Delight has actually edible sushi for about the same price (if you can get over the kitschy name).  Miyabi is possibly the worst sushi restaurant I've been to in SF.
author: Leslie L.

description: prices are right and food is pretty good, but the service leaves something to be desired. Most of the time you just get ignored for a LONG time. That's the downfall .
author: RED L.

description: Friendly, efficient service and low prices, especially for Japanese in this area.  But you get what you pay for.  Chicken udon was okay but the quality of the meat was poor.  Cold tofu was the most boring dish I could imagine; zero effort expended on it.  The sushi was okay but avocado was discolored.  I would stick to the deep-fried rolls without any raw fish in them to be safe.  Finally, for some unknown reason they play the absolute worst adult soft rock music on the planet.  If you are dining alone, bring headphones or earplugs!!!
author: Geoffrey U.

description: Affordable and good.  Their bento box combos are a lot of food for your buck!  Shout out to their new location!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
author: Allison M.

description: was not impressed with this place at all. i only went here because my friend wanted sushi and we were in the neighbourhood and it was too late to deal with the wait for sushi zone (which is close by to this crappy sushi place). my friend is Japanese and she loves this place! i was pretty surprised she liked this place. the place and the customers were pretty ghetto looking. the service sucked. i ordered a couple of nigiris (maguro and albacore) and they didn't seem all that fresh to me. i won't go back here EVER!!
author: James J.

description: This is a Koerean Japanese sushi restaurant. A lot of spicy sensation to the "zen-like" japanese sushi. I love it for the variety of ROLLS.... Good sashime too.
author: T L.

description: you can't go wrong with their delicious, substantial rolls and not only that, they have reasonable prices!!!. dinner and combo plates are pretty decent.
author: Nelle A.

description: mmmmmmmmmmmiyabi.  tasty, fresh, uncomplicated rolls and super nice, if slightly inattentive, service- what more could you ask for at 1130pm?
author: Samantha W.

description: i dont like this place anymore. used to stop here on the way home for some sushi, but i'm finding that the sushi here is not fresh, not great,rolls unimpressive, service is a bit cold for a japanese joint, and not much interesting about this place that makes it stand out amongst many great sushi places in the area.  i looked closely at the nigiri and the fish looked old, thin, and unimpressive. i dont mean to knock on this place, but i dont think i'll stop by anymore. and this review is based on eating there quite a number of times. very so-so.
author: Miss Lili F.

description:
first off, i didn't have the sushi so i can't comment on that.

i got the beef udon and it was just not good.  i mean, i eat a lot of udon and not only were the noodles soggy (it was take-out, but i live in the neighborhood - so not enough time for noodles to get soggy), the broth was not good and the beef was old tasting.  and it tasted like major msg or something just not good.

i really wanted to like the place after all the great reviews, but alas, this is not going to be my local udon shop.

extra star for really nice service.  i was served hot tea as i was waiting.  AND! the cups are really nice.  the tea was really hot but the cup was not.  at first i thought it was lukewarm tea, but no, the cup provided really good insulation.
author: Liz M.

description: My favorite sushi place ever. The dressing for the salad is the BEST. I have tried lots of their rolls and havent been disapointed yet!
author: Melisa C.

description: Great sushi & service + open late. Plus if you leave your wallet\purse there, you will get it back.
author: sizuck m.

description: This place is great! I've been going here for years and I can't get enough, the prices are crazy low and the food is down right delicious. If you get a chance to go for lunch you can get the lunch bento box for cheap cheap cheap! Totemo Oishii!!!
author: Jesse V.

description: pretty good fish for good prices. the seaweed salad was delicious, and the service was great.
author: Julia H.

description: I came here for lunch today. Being lazy, i just ordered the bento box.  The portion is really really big. For 8 bucks, you get 2 pieces of gyoza, some tempura, chicken teriyaky, 6 pieces of california roll and the usual (rice, salad, and miso soup).  The service was great too.  The reason for only 3 stars is that the chicken was pretty dry. I expect something simple like the chicken teriyaki would be better.
author: Jane K.

description: This is my favorite sushi place in the city (and I have tried a lot of them.)  You get great sushi for a mid level price.  Every time we go they bring us something to try on the house and all the sushi we have tried have been excellent.  I cannot speak for other items on the menu since when we go here, we want sushi.
author: Jeffery B.

description: not crowded (at 10 pm) and very relievd that they are opend till 12am! how many good sushi places are open for you when you need them....got the love boat, can't go wrong with that=)
author: Janelle H.

description: We have become Miyabi regulars for those nights when we need something nearby, fast and tasty. A Vegetable Tempura starter, followed by a selection of rolls including Alaska, Mango Tempura, and Cream Cheese Avocado just hits the spot. It would be nice if the starter was served before the main course, but I'm just happy to get my food fast.
author: Chris W.

description: eh.  The service was ok.  The rolls were pretty good, but nothing great and nothing I haven't seen already.
author: blythewood m.

description: Nothing fancy.  Neighborhood restaurant with consistently good sushi and rolls at reasonable prices.
author: Brian P.

description: this place is on the top of my list for sushi...it may not be the fanciest ,but what it lacks in refinement...it more than makes up for in taste and price...they are open late and that's great for those late sushi attacks... Some of my favorite things are the asparagus and mango roll and salmon teriyaki...also their salad dressing is really good , i cant explain it, and maybe its just me but i have to admit i have stolen a bottle or two for use at home...shhhhh...granted this place doesn't serve the most traditional of Japanese cuisine, they dont charge the prices of those traditional cuisines either... the tempura is light and crispy and they use that butternut squash for one of their vegetables in the tempura, my personal favorite....id say if your looking for great neighborhood place to eat some quality sushi and not break your wallet ...i highly suggest this place.
author: ridin' d.
